8.verse: Now to this people you will say, thus says ADONAI: “Look, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

9.verse: He who remains in this city will die by the sword, by the famine, or by the pestilence. But whoever goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who are besieging you, he will live, and he will have his life as prize.”

10.verse: “For I have set My face against this city for evil, not for good.” It is a declaration of ADONAI. “It will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.”

11.verse: Also to the house of the king of Judah, hear the word of ADONAI,

12.verse: O house of David, thus says ADONAI: “Render justice by morning, and rescue the one who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor. Otherwise My fury will go forth like fire and burn so none can extinguish it, because of their evil deeds.”

13.verse: “Here I am, against you, situated in the valley, a rocky plateau”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“You are saying, ‘Who would come down against us? Who would enter into our lairs?’

14.verse: I will punish you according to the fruit of your deeds.” It is a declaration of ADONAI. “Also I will set fire to her forest, and it will consume all around her.”

1.verse: Warning to David’s Heirs - Thus said ADONAI: “Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and speak this word:

2.verse: ‘Hear the word of ADONAI, O king of Judah, who sits on the throne of David—you, your servants, and your people who enter by these gates.’

3.verse: Thus says ADONAI: ‘Execute justice and righteousness. Rescue the one who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor. Do not mistreat or do violence to the stranger, the fatherless or the widow. Do not shed innocent blood in this place.

4.verse: For if you really carry out this word, then through the gates of this palace will enter kings sitting on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses—himself, his servants, and his people.

5.verse: But if you will not obey these words, I swear by Myself,’ declares ADONAI, ‘that this palace will become a ruin.’”

6.verse: For thus says ADONAI concerning the house of the king of Judah: “You are Gilead to Me— the summit of Lebanon, yet I will surely make you into a wilderness, uninhabited cities.

7.verse: I will consecrate destroyers against you, each with his own weapons. They will cut down your choice cedars and cast them into the fire.

8.verse: Many nations will pass by this city, and they will say, each to his neighbor, ‘Why has ADONAI done such a thing to this great city?’

9.verse: Then they will answer: ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of ADONAI their God, and worshipped other gods and served them.’”

10.verse: Weep not for the dead or bemoan him. Weep bitterly for him who departs, for he will never return, or see his native country again.

11.verse: For thus says ADONAI to Shallum, son of King Josiah of Judah, who became king in place of his father Josiah: “He who went forth from this place will never return there.

12.verse: Instead, in the place where they led him captive, there will he die—he will see this land no more.”

13.verse: Oy to him who builds his house by unrighteousness, and his roof-chambers by injustice, that makes his neighbor work without pay, never giving him his wages,

14.verse: who says: “I will build myself a big house with spacious rooms and cut out my windows for it, and panel it with cedar, and paint it with vermilion!

15.verse: Did you become king just to be striving with cedar? Did your father not eat and drink, and do justice and righteousness? Then it went well with him.

16.verse: He pled the case of the poor and weak, so it went well. Is not this knowledge of Me?” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

17.verse: “But your eyes and your heart are only on your unjust gain, and on shedding innocent blood, and committing extortion and fraud.”

18.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI about Jehoiakim son of King Josiah of Judah: “They will not lament for him, ‘Oy, my brother!’ or ‘Oy, sister!’ They will not lament for him, ‘Oy, master!’ or ‘Oy, his majesty!’

19.verse: With a donkey’s burial will he be buried, dragged off and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.

20.verse: Go up to Lebanon and cry out, and lift up your voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim— for all your lovers are broken.

21.verse: I spoke to you in your prosperity, but you said, ‘I won’t listen!’ This has been your way since your youth— for you never listened to My voice.

22.verse: The wind will shepherd away all of your shepherds, and your lovers will go into exile. Surely then you will be ashamed and humbled by all your wickedness.

23.verse: O inhabitant of Lebanon, nestled in the cedars, how you will groan when pangs come on you, pain like a woman in travail!

24.verse: “As I live,” declares ADONAI, “even if Coniah son of King Jehoiakim of Judah were a signet ring on My right hand, yet I would pull you off,

25.verse: and give you over into the hand of those seeking your life, yes, into the hand of those whom you dread, even into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and into the hand of the Chaldeans.

26.verse: So I will cast you out, with your mother who bore you, into another country where you were not born—and there will you die.

27.verse: But as for the land where they long to return, they will never return there.”

28.verse: Is this man Coniah a despised, shattered pot— a jar with no delight in it? Why are he and his seed cast out into the land they do not know?

29.verse: O land, land, land, hear the word of ADONAI!

30.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Write this man childless, a man who will not prosper in his days. For no man of his seed will prosper, sitting on the throne of David and ruling again in Judah.”

1.verse: Gathering His Flock - “Woe to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of My pasture!” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

2.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, about the shepherds who feed My people: “You have scattered My flock, driven them away, and have not taken care of them. I will soon visit on you the evil of your deeds.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

3.verse: “I will gather the remnant of My flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and will bring them back to their folds, and they will be fruitful and multiply.

4.verse: I will raise up shepherds over them who will feed them. They will no longer be afraid or dismayed, nor will any be missing,” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

5.verse: The Righteous Branch - “Behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and He will reign as king wisely, and execute justice and righteousness in the land.

6.verse: In His days Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell in safely; and this is His Name by which He will be called: ADONAI our righteousness.

7.verse: “Therefore behold, days are coming,” says ADONAI, “when they will no longer say: ‘As ADONAI lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.’

8.verse: Rather, ‘As ADONAI lives, who brought up and led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the north country and from all the lands where He had banished them.’ So they will dwell in their own soil.

9.verse: Avoid Ungodly Prophets - As for the prophets: My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake. I am like a drunken man, like a man overcome by wine because of ADONAI, because of His holy words.

10.verse: For the land is full of adulterers. The land mourns because of a curse. Pastures of the wilderness are dry. Their running is evil, and their might is not right.

11.verse: For both prophet and kohen are ungodly. Even in My House I found their evil.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

12.verse: “Therefore their way will be for them like slippery places in the gloom. They will be driven away and fall there, for I will bring calamity on them, even the year of their visitation.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

13.verse: Moreover, I have seen unseemliness in the prophets of Samaria: they prophesied by Baal, and led My people Israel astray.

14.verse: But in the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a horrible thing: committing adultery and walking in lies. They strengthen the hands of evildoers. No one turns back from his evil. They are all like Sodom to Me and her inhabitants like Gomorrah.”

15.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot concerning the prophets: “I myself will feed them wormwood and make them drink poisoned water. For from the prophets of Jerusalem pollution has spread into all the land.”

16.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Do not listen to the words of prophets who are prophesying to you. They are leading you into illusion, speaking a vision of their own heart and not out of the mouth of ADONAI.

17.verse: They keep saying to those who despise Me, ‘ADONAI has said, you will have shalom.’ To everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart they say: ‘No evil will come on you.’”

18.verse: For who has stood in the council of ADONAI, that he should see and hear His word? Who has heard to His word and obeyed?

19.verse: Look, a storm of ADONAI goes out in fury, yes, a whirling tempest will swirl down on the head of the wicked.

20.verse: The anger of ADONAI will not turn until He has executed and fulfilled the purposes of His heart. In the last days you will discern it clearly.

21.verse: “I did not send those prophets, yet they ran. I did not speak to them, yet they prophesied.

22.verse: If they have stood in My council, then they would have announced My words to My people, and turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their deeds.”

23.verse: “Am I God only when near” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “and not God when far off?

24.verse: Can anyone hide himself in places so secret that I will not see him? Do I not fill heaven and earth?” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

25.verse: “I have heard what the prophets said, who prophesy lies in My Name, saying: ‘I had a dream, I had a dream!’

26.verse: How long will this continue? Is there anything in the heart of such prophets prophesying lies? These prophets have deception in their heart.

27.verse: Through their dreams that they each tell to his companion, that intend to make My people forget My Name—just as their fathers forgot My Name because of Baal.

28.verse: “The prophet who has a dream may recount a dream, but let the one who has My word speak My word in truth. For what is straw compared with wheat?” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

29.verse: “Is not My word like fire?” says ADONAI, “or like a hammer that shatters rock?

30.verse: “Therefore here I am against the prophets”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“who steal My words from each other.

31.verse: Indeed, I am against the prophets”, declares ADONAI, “who use their tongues to utter a prophecy, ‘It is a declaration!’

32.verse: Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams,” declares ADONAI, “and tell them, and so lead My people astray with their lies and with their reckless boasts. Yet I never sent them or commanded them. Nor do they benefit this people at all.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

33.verse: “Now when this people or a prophet or a kohen is asking you: ‘What is the burden of ADONAI?’ then you are to say to them, ‘What burden? I will cast you off!’” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

34.verse: “As for the prophet or kohen or people who keep saying, ‘The burden of ADONAI!’—I will punish that man and his household.

35.verse: Thus each of you may say to his companion and each one to his brother, ‘What has ADONAI answered?’ or ‘What has ADONAI spoken?’

36.verse: But you should no longer remember ‘the burden of ADONAI’—for to each one, his own word is becoming ‘the burden’! So you have perverted the words of the living God, of ADONAI-Tzva’ot our God.

37.verse: “So you are to say to such a prophet, ‘What has ADONAI answered you?’ and ‘What has ADONAI spoken?’

38.verse: But if you say, ‘The burden of ADONAI,’” then surely ADONAI says, “because you keep saying this word: ‘The burden of ADONAI,’ when I sent this word to you, you are not to say ‘The burden of ADONAI’—

39.verse: therefore, I will surely forget you when I will cast you off, along with the city that I gave to you and to your fathers, away from My presence.

40.verse: Then I will bring everlasting disgrace on you and everlasting shame that will not be forgotten.”

1.verse: Parable of the Baskets of Figs - ADONAI showed me, all of a sudden, there were two baskets of figs set before the Temple of ADONAI. It was after King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had taken away into exile Jeconiah son of King Jehoiakim of Judah and the princes of Judah, along with the craftsmen and smiths from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

2.verse: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first ripe, but the other basket had very bad figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.

3.verse: Then ADONAI said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” So I said, “Figs—the good figs are very good, but the bad are very bad, and cannot be eaten, they are so bad.”

4.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to me, saying,

5.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “Like these good figs, so will I regard the exiles of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place to the land of the Chaldeans, as good.

6.verse: I will set My eyes on them as good. I will bring them back to this land, and I will build them up and not pull them down; I will plant them and not uproot them.

7.verse: Then I will give them a heart to know Me—for I am ADONAI—and they will be My people, and I will be their God. For they will return to Me with their whole heart.

8.verse: “Now as for the bad figs, which cannot be eaten they are so bad”—surely thus says ADONAI—“so I will give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, his princes and the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, as well as those dwelling in the land of Egypt.

9.verse: I will even give them as a horror, as an evil thing, among all the kingdoms of the earth—as a disgrace and a proverb, a taunt and a curse—in all places where I will drive them.

10.verse: I will also send the sword, famine and pestilence among them, until they be consumed from off the land that I gave to them and to their fathers.”

1.verse: Unheard Voice of the Prophets - The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah (which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon).

2.verse: Jeremiah the prophet spoke it to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying:

3.verse: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah, until this day—these 23 years—the word of ADONAI has come to me. So I have spoken to you, speaking early and often, but you have not listened.

4.verse: Moreover, ADONAI has sent to you all His servants the prophets, sending them early and often—but you have not listened or inclined your ear to hear—

5.verse: saying: ‘Turn, now, everyone from his evil way, and from the evil of your deeds, and dwell in the land that ADONAI has given to you and to your fathers forever and ever.

6.verse: Do not go after other gods to serve them, to worship them, and so do not provoke Me with the work of your hands, so I would do you no harm.’

7.verse: “Yet you have not listened to Me,” declares ADONAI. “So you are provoking Me with the work of your hands, to your own hurt.”

8.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Since you have not heard My words,

9.verse: I will soon send for and bring all the families of the north”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“and I will send for King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land, and against its inhabitants, and against all these nations round about, and I will utterly destroy them, and make them a horror, and a hissing, an enduring desolation.

10.verse: “Moreover, I will silence among them the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones and the light of the lamp.

11.verse: Seventy Years of Desolation - “So this whole land will be a desolate ruin, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for 70 years.

12.verse: Then it will come to pass, when 70 years are completed, that I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,” declares ADONAI, “the land of the Chaldeans, for their iniquity, and I will make it ruins forever.

13.verse: I will bring on that land all My words which I pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.

14.verse: For many nations and great kings will make slaves of them also. So I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the work of their own hands.”

15.verse: Cup of Fury and Reeling - For thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, to me: “Take this cup of the wine of fury from My hand, and make all the nations to whom I am sending you drink it.

16.verse: They will drink, and reel to and fro, and be like madmen, because of the sword that I will send among them.

17.verse: Then I took the cup from ADONAI’s hand, and made all the nations drink, to whom ADONAI had sent me:

18.verse: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, with its kings and its princes—to make them an appalling horror and hissing, a curse as it is this day;

19.verse: Pharaoh king of Egypt, with his servants, his princes and all his people;

20.verse: and all the mingled people, all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the land of the Philistines, Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;

21.verse: Edom, Moab, and Ammon’s children;

22.verse: all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the coastland across the sea;

23.verse: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who shave the corners;

24.verse: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed people dwelling in the wilderness;

25.verse: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam and all the kings of Media;

26.verse: all the kings of the north, either far or close to another; and all the kingdoms of the world which are on the face of the earth. And the king of Sheshach will drink after them.”

27.verse: And you will say to them, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Drink, be drunken, vomit, fall down and rise no more, because of the sword that I will send among you.”

28.verse: And if they refuse to take the cup at your hand to drink, then here is what you will say to them: “Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, you will surely drink!

29.verse: See, I am beginning to bring evil on the city where My name is called, and should you go completely unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am summoning a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth.” It is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

30.verse: Therefore you are to prophesy against them all these words, and say to them: “ADONAI is roaring from on high, giving voice from His holy dwelling. He roars mightily over His sheepfold. He shouts like those who tread grapes, against all who dwell on the earth.

31.verse: A noise has come to the end of the earth, for ADONAI has a dispute with the nations. He is passing judgment on all flesh. As for the wicked, He has given them over to the sword.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

32.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Evil will soon go forth from nation to nation. A great storm is being stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.

33.verse: Those slain by ADONAI on that day will be from one end of the earth to the other end of the earth. They will not be lamented, gathered, or buried; they will be dung on the surface of the ground.”

34.verse: Wail, you shepherds, and cry! Wallow in the dust, you leaders of the flock! For the days of your slaughter and your dispersions are full. You will fall like a precious vase.

35.verse: For the shepherds will have no way to flee, nor the leaders of the flock to escape.

36.verse: Hark! The outcry of the shepherds, the wailing of the leaders of the flock! For ADONAI is ravaging their pasture.

37.verse: The peace of the pasture is stifled because of the fierce anger of ADONAI.

38.verse: He has left His lair, like a lion. For their land has become a waste, because of the fury of the oppressor and because of His fierce anger.

1.verse: Surviving a Death Sentence - In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from ADONAI, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI: “Stand in the court of ADONAI’s House, and speak to all the cities of Judah that come to worship in ADONAI’s House all the words that I command you to speak to them. Do not omit a word!

3.verse: Perhaps they will listen, and turn every man from his evil way, so I may relent of the calamity which I am planning to do to them because of the evil of their deeds.”

4.verse: Then you will say to them, thus says ADONAI: “If you will not listen to Me, by walking in My Torah, which I have set before you,

5.verse: and by listening to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I have been sending to you, early and often—but you have not listened—

6.verse: then I will make this House like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.”

7.verse: So the kohanim, the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the House of ADONAI.

8.verse: Now when Jeremiah finished speaking all that ADONAI had commanded him to speak to all the people, the kohanim and the prophets and all the people laid hold on him, saying: “You will surely die!

9.verse: Why have you prophesied in the Name of ADONAI, saying, ‘This House will be like Shiloh, and this city will be an uninhabited ruin?’” Then all the people gathered against Jeremiah in the House of ADONAI.

10.verse: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s palace to the House of ADONAI, and sat in the entrance of the New Gate of ADONAI’s House.

11.verse: The kohanim and the prophets spoke to the princes and to all the people, saying: “A death sentence for this man! For he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”

12.verse: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and to all the people, saying: “ADONAI sent me to prophesy all the words you have heard against this House and against this city.

13.verse: So now, mend your ways and your deeds, and obey the voice of ADONAI your God; so ADONAI will relent of the calamity that He has pronounced against you.

14.verse: “But as for me, here I am in your hand; do with me as is good and right in your eyes.

15.verse: Only know for certain that, if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants. For in truth ADONAI has sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”

16.verse: Then said the princes and all the people to the kohanim and to the prophets: “No death sentence for this man! For he has spoken to us in the Name of ADONAI our God.”

17.verse: Then some of the elders of the land rose up and addressed all the assembly of the people, saying:

18.verse: “Micah the Morashtite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and he spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: ‘Zion will be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem will become ruins, and the mountain of the House as the high places of a forest.’

19.verse: “Did King Hezekiah of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Didn’t he fear ADONAI and plead for the favor of ADONAI, and then ADONAI relented of the calamity that He had pronounced against them? So we may be committing great evil against our own souls.”

20.verse: Now there was a man who had prophesied in the Name of ADONAI, Uriah son of Shemaiah of Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land words like all those of Jeremiah.

21.verse: When King Jehoiakim with all his mighty men and all the princes heard his words, the king sought to put him to death. But when Uriah heard it, he was afraid and fled, and went to Egypt.

22.verse: So King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt—Elnathan son of Achbor and some others with him—

23.verse: and they brought Uriah back from Egypt, and led him to King Jehoiakim, who slew him with the sword and threw his corpse into the burial place of the common people.

24.verse: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they did not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.

1.verse: Jeremiah Wears a Yoke - In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, came this word to Jeremiah from ADONAI, saying—

2.verse: thus says ADONAI to me—“Make straps and yoke-bars, and put them on your neck.

3.verse: Then send such to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of Ammon’s children, to the king of Tyre and to the king of Zidon, by the hand of messengers that come to Jerusalem to King Zedekiah of Judah.

4.verse: Charge them to their masters, saying, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, thus will you say to your masters:

5.verse: ‘I have made the earth, mankind and beast which are on the face of the earth, by My great power and by My outstretched arm—and I give it to whom it seems right to Me.

6.verse: So now I have given all these lands into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, My servant. I have even given the beasts of the field to serve him.

7.verse: All the nations will serve him—and his son, and his grandson—until the time of his own land comes, and then many nations and great kings will make him their slave.’

8.verse: “Now it will be, that the nation or the kingdom which will not serve the same King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, and will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will punish with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence,” declares ADONAI, “until I have destroyed it by his hand.

9.verse: But as for you, do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreams, your soothsayers, or your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon.’

10.verse: For they prophesy a lie to you, in order to remove you far from your land, so that I would drive you out and you would perish.

11.verse: “But the nation that will bring their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, that nation I will let remain in its land, and they will till it and dwell in it.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

12.verse: Then I spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah with all these same words, saying: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, serve him and his people—and live.

13.verse: Why should you die—you and your people—by the sword, by famine, or by pestilence, as ADONAI has spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?

14.verse: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy a lie to you.”

15.verse: “For I have not sent them,” says ADONAI, “and they prophesy falsely in My Name, with the result that I will drive you out, and that you will perish—you and the prophets that prophesy to you.”

16.verse: Then I spoke to the kohanim and to all this people, saying, thus says ADONAI: “Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying: ‘See, the vessels of ADONAI’s House will now shortly be brought back from Babylon’—for they prophesy a lie to you.

17.verse: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city become a ruin?

18.verse: But if they are prophets, and if the word of ADONAI is with them, let them now make intercession to ADONAI-Tzva’ot, that the vessels that are left in the House of ADONAI, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, would not go to Babylon.”

19.verse: For thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot concerning the pillars, the sea, the bases, and the rest of the vessels that remain in this city,

20.verse: which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon has not taken, when he carried away captive Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem,

21.verse: yes, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the House of ADONAI, in the house of the king of Judah and at Jerusalem:

22.verse: “They will be brought to Babylon, and there will they be until the day that I take note of them”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“and bring them up and restore them to this place.”

1.verse: A False Prophecy, Too Soon - Now it was the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah son of Azzur the prophet from Gibeon spoke to me in the House of ADONAI, in the presence of the kohanim and of all the people, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, saying: “I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon!

3.verse: Within two full years I will bring back to this place all the vessels of ADONAI’s House that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and brought to Babylon.

4.verse: I will also bring Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, back to this place with all the captives of Judah that went to Babylon”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”

5.verse: Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the kohanim and in the presence of all the people that stood in ADONAI’s House.

6.verse: So the prophet Jeremiah said: “Amen! May ADONAI do so! May ADONAI fulfill your words that you have prophesied, bringing back the vessels of ADONAI’s House and all those who are taken away captive, from Babylon to this place!

7.verse: Yet hear now this word that I am speaking in your ears and in the ears of all the people.

8.verse: The prophets who have been before me and before you of ancient times prophesied against many countries and against great kingdoms—of war, catastrophe and plague.

9.verse: The prophet who prophesies shalom—when the word of the prophet has come to pass, then will the prophet be known as one that ADONAI has truly sent.”

10.verse: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke-bar from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck and broke it.

11.verse: Hananiah proclaimed in the presence of all the people, saying, thus says ADONAI: “Just so I will break the yoke of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon from off the neck of all the nations within two full years.” So the prophet Jeremiah went his way.

12.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke-bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying:

13.verse: “Go, tell Hananiah, saying, thus says ADONAI: ‘You have broken the yoke-bars of wood—but in its place you will make yoke-bars of iron.’”

14.verse: For thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, so that they may serve King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. They will serve him, and I have also given him the beasts of the field.”

15.verse: Then said the prophet Jeremiah to the prophet Hananiah: “Hear now, Hananiah! ADONAI has not sent you, yet you have caused this people to trust in a lie.

16.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI: I am about to send you away from off the face of the earth. This year you will die, since you have spoken apostasy against ADONAI.”

17.verse: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.

1.verse: After Seventy Years, a Future Hope - Now these are the words of the letter that the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the elders remaining in exile, as well as to the kohanim, the prophets and to all the people Nebuchadnezzar had carried off captive from Jerusalem to Babylon

2.verse: (after Jeconiah the king, the queen-mother, the officers, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen and the smiths, had to leave Jerusalem). The letter was sent

3.verse: by the hand of Elasah son of Shaphan, and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, saying,

4.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, to all those in captivity, whom I removed as captives into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon:

5.verse: “Build houses and live in them; also plant gardens and eat their fruit;

6.verse: take wives and have sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands, so that they may bear sons and daughters; and multiply there, and do not decrease.

7.verse: Also seek the shalom of the city where I took you as captives in exile, and pray to ADONAI for it—for in its shalom will you have shalom.”

8.verse: For thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “Do not let your prophets who are among you or your diviners beguile you, and pay no attention to the dreams which you make them keep dreaming.

9.verse: For they prophesy falsely to you in My Name; I have not sent them.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

10.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “After 70 years for Babylon are complete, I will visit you, and fulfill My good word toward you—to bring you back to this place.

11.verse: For I know the plans that I have in mind for you,” declares ADONAI, “plans for shalom and not calamity—to give you a future and a hope.

12.verse: “Then you will call on Me, and come and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.

13.verse: You will seek Me and find Me, when you will search for Me with all your heart.

14.verse: Then I will be found by you,” says ADONAI, “and I will return you from exile, and gather you from all the nations and from all the places where I have driven you,” says ADONAI, “and I will bring you back to the place from which I removed you as captives into exile.”

15.verse: For you have said: “ADONAI has raised up prophets for us in Babylon.”

16.verse: For thus says ADONAI about the king who sits on the throne of David and about all the people who dwell in this city, your kinsmen who did not go with you into captivity,

17.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “I am about to send on them the sword, famine and pestilence, and will make them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.

18.verse: I will pursue them with the sword, famine and pestilence, and will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth—a curse and an astonishment, a hissing and a disgrace—among all the nations where I have driven them,

19.verse: because they have not listened to My words,” declares ADONAI, “which I sent to them by My servants the prophets, sending them early and often, but you would not hear.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

20.verse: “But you, hear the word of ADONAI, all you of the exile whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon,”

21.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, “concerning Ahab son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in My name: I will soon deliver them into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and he will slay them before your eyes.

22.verse: So a curse will be taken up by everyone in exile from Judah who are in Babylon, saying: ‘May ADONAI make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire’—

23.verse: because they have been disgraceful in Israel, committing adultery with their neighbors’ wives and speaking words in My Name falsely, which I did not command them. But I am the One who knows and I am witness.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

24.verse: Now concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you will surely say,

25.verse: thus declares ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, saying: “Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are at Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the kohen, and to all the kohanim, saying:

26.verse: ‘ADONAI has made you kohen instead of Jehoiada the kohen, so that there should be officers in the House of ADONAI for every madman prophesying and so that you will put him in the stocks and iron collar.

27.verse: So now, why haven’t you rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who makes himself out to be a prophet to you?

28.verse: For he has sent word to us in Babylon, saying: “The exile will be long—build houses and live in them; plant gardens and eat their fruit.’”

29.verse: So Zephaniah the kohen read this letter in the ears of the prophet Jeremiah.

30.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah, saying:

31.verse: Send word to all of the captivity, saying, thus says ADONAI concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: “Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, though I did not send him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie,”

32.verse: therefore thus says ADONAI, “I will indeed punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his offspring. There will be none living among this people, and he will not see the good that I will do to My people,” declares ADONAI, “because he has spoken rebellion against ADONAI.”

1.verse: Return From Exile - The word came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, saying:

2.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “Write all the words that I have spoken to you in a scroll.

3.verse: For behold, the days are coming,” declares ADONAI, “when I will return My people Israel and Judah from exile,” declares ADONAI. “I will bring them back to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.”

4.verse: Dread of Jacob’s Trouble - Now these are the words that ADONAI spoke to Israel and to Judah.

5.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “We heard a sound of trembling, of dread—there is no shalom.

6.verse: Ask now, and see whether a man can give birth. Why do I see every man with his hands on his loins, like a woman giving birth? Why have all faces turned pale?

7.verse: Oy! For that day is monumental. There will be none like it— a time of trouble for Jacob! Yet out of it he will be saved.

8.verse: A Davidic King Brings Healing - It will be in that day” —it is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot— “that I will break his yoke from off your neck, and will tear off your bonds. Foreigners will no longer enslave him.

9.verse: Instead they will serve ADONAI their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.

10.verse: So now, do not fear, Jacob My servant,” says ADONAI, “nor be dismayed, O Israel, for behold, I will save you from afar, your seed from the land of their exile. Jacob will again be quiet and at ease, and no one will make him afraid.

11.verse: For I am with you,” declares ADONAI, “to save you, for I will make a full end of all the nations where I scatter you. but I will not make a full end of you. For I will discipline you justly, but will not leave you unpunished.”

12.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Your hurt is incurable, and your wound is severe.

13.verse: No one pleads your cause, for there is no remedy for your wound, no healing for you.

14.verse: All your lovers have forgotten you. They are not looking for you. For I wounded you as an enemy— with cruel punishment— because your iniquity is vast, your sins innumerable.

15.verse: Why cry about your fracture? Your pain has no cure. Because your iniquity is vast, your sins innumerable, I did these things to you.

16.verse: Yet all who devour you will be devoured, and all your foes—all of them— will go into captivity. Those plundering you will be plundered, and all preying on you I give as prey.

17.verse: For I will restore health to you and will heal you of your wounds.” It is a declaration of ADONAI. “For they called you an outcast: ‘Zion—no one cares about her.’”

18.verse: Thus says ADONAI, “Indeed, I will return Jacob’s tents from exile, and have compassion on his dwellings. The city will be rebuilt on her mound. The citadel will stand in its rightful place.

19.verse: Out of them will come thanksgiving and the sound of celebration. I will multiply them, so they will not decrease. I will also honor them, so they will not be insignificant.

20.verse: His children also will be as formerly —his community set up before Me— and I will punish all his oppressors.

21.verse: His noble one will be one of His own. His ruler will come forth from among His own. I will bring Him near, and He will approach Me. For who is he who will pledge his heart to approach Me?” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

22.verse: “So you will be My people, and I will be your God.”

23.verse: Look! A storm of ADONAI! Fury has burst out as a churning storm, whirling about the head of the wicked.

24.verse: ADONAI’s fierce anger will not turn back until He has done it, until He fulfills the purposes of His heart. in the last days you will understand it.

1.verse: Saving the Remnant - Thus says ADONAI: “The people surviving the sword found grace in the wilderness— where I gave Israel rest.”

2.verse: “From afar ADONAI appeared to me.” “Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love. Therefore I have drawn you with lovingkindness.

3.verse: Again I will build you, so you will be rebuilt, virgin Israel! Again you will take up your tambourines as ornaments, and go out to dances of merrymakers.

4.verse: Again you will plant vineyards on the hills of Samaria— planters will plant and use them.

5.verse: For there will be a day when watchmen will call out in the hill country of Ephraim, ‘Arise, let us go up to Zion, to ADONAI our God.’”

6.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Sing aloud with joy for Jacob! Shout with the chief of the nations! Proclaim, give praise, and say: ‘ADONAI, save your people, the remnant of Israel!’

7.verse: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and I will gather them from the ends of the earth— among them the blind and the lame, the pregnant together with she who is in labor with child. A great throng will return here.

8.verse: With weeping and supplications they will come. I will bring them, leading them to walk by streams of water on a straight path where they will not stumble. For I am Israel’s father, and Ephraim is My firstborn.”

9.verse: Hear the word of ADONAI, O nations, and declare it in the distant islands, and say: ‘He who scattered Israel will gather and watch over him, as a shepherd does his flock.’

10.verse: For ADONAI has ransomed Jacob. He redeemed him from the hand of one stronger than he.

11.verse: They will come and sing on Zion’s height, radiant over the bounty of ADONAI— over the grain, the wine, the oil, and the young of the flock. Their life will be like a watered garden, and they will never languish again.

12.verse: Then will the virgin rejoice in the dance, both young men and old men together. For I will turn their mourning into joy, and I will comfort them, and make them rejoice out of their sorrow.

13.verse: I will fill the soul of the kohanim with fatness and My people will be satisfied with My goodness.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

14.verse: Grief Turned to Joy - Thus says ADONAI: “A voice is heard in Ramah —lamentation and bitter weeping— Rachel weeping for her children, refusing to be comforted for her children, because they are no more.”

15.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Restrain your voice from weeping and your eyes from tears. For your work will be rewarded” —it is declaration of ADONAI— “when they will return from the land of the enemy.

16.verse: So there is hope for your future” —it is declaration of ADONAI— “when your children will return to their own territory.

17.verse: I indeed heard Ephraim grieving: ‘You have disciplined me— I was disciplined like an untrained calf. Restore me, and I will return, for you are ADONAI my God.

18.verse: For after I returned, I repented, and after that I was instructed, I struck my thigh— I was ashamed and also humiliated, for I bore the disgrace of my youth.’

19.verse: Is Ephraim a precious son to Me? Is he a delightful child? For as often as I spoke against him, I still certainly remember him. Therefore My heart yearns for him. I will surely have compassion on him.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

20.verse: Erect road markers, set up signposts! Set your heart toward the highway, the way by which you traveled! Return, O virgin Israel, return to your cities.

21.verse: How long will you waver, O backsliding daughter? For ADONAI has created a new thing on earth: a woman surrounds a man.

22.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Yet again will they use this expression in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I will return them from exile: ‘ADONAI bless you, O dwelling of righteousness, O mountain of holiness.’

23.verse: Judah and all its cities will dwell there together—the farmer and those who go about with flocks.

24.verse: For I will satisfy the weary soul, and every languishing soul will refresh.”

25.verse: At this point I awoke, and looked around, and my sleep was sweet to me.

26.verse: “Behold, days are coming”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of beast.

27.verse: Now just as I have watched over them to uproot and to pull down, to overthrow, to destroy, and to bring disaster, then I will watch over them to build and to plant,” says ADONAI.

28.verse: “In those days they will no longer say: ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are blunted.’

29.verse: Rather each will die for his own iniquity: if anyone eats the sour grapes, his own teeth will be blunted.”

30.verse: New Covenant Foretold - “Behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah—

31.verse: not like the covenant I made with their fathers in the day I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt. For they broke My covenant, though I was a husband to them.” it is a declaration of ADONAI.

32.verse: “But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after those days” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “I will put My Torah within them. Yes, I will write it on their heart. I will be their God and they will be My people.

33.verse: No longer will each teach his neighbor or each his brother, saying: ‘Know ADONAI,’ for they will all know Me, from the least of them to the greatest.” it is a declaration of ADONAI. “For I will forgive their iniquity, their sin I will remember no more.”

34.verse: Thus says ADONAI, who gives the sun as a light by day and the fixed order of the moon and the stars as a light by night, who stirs up the sea so its waves roar, ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name:

35.verse: “Only if this fixed order departs from before Me” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “then also might Israel’s offspring cease from being a nation before Me—for all time.”

36.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Only if heaven above can be measured and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then also I will cast off the offspring of Israel —for all they have done.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

37.verse: “Behold, days are coming”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“when the city will be rebuilt for ADONAI, from the tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.

38.verse: The measuring line will go out farther, straight to the Gareb Hill, then turn to Goah.

39.verse: Then the whole valley—the dead bodies and the ashes, and all the fields up to the Kidron Valley to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east—will be holy to ADONAI. It will never be uprooted or thrown down again—forever.”

40.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

1.verse: Why Jeremiah Bought Property - The word that came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, in the tenth year of King Zedekiah of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

2.verse: Now at the time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the palace of the king of Judah.

3.verse: For King Zedekiah of Judah had shut him up, saying: “Why do you prophesy and say, thus says ADONAI: ‘I will soon give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will take it;

4.verse: and King Zedekiah of Judah will not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but will surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him mouth to mouth and his eyes will behold his eyes;

5.verse: and he will lead Zedekiah to Babylon, and there will he remain until I take note of him,’ says ADONAI—though you fight with the Chaldeans, you will not succeed?”

6.verse: So Jeremiah said: “The word of ADONAI came to me, saying:

7.verse: ‘Hanamel, son of Shallum your uncle, will soon come to you saying: ‘Buy for yourself my field in Anathoth, for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.’”

8.verse: So my uncle’s son Hanamel came to me in the court of the guard as was the word of ADONAI, and said to me: “Buy my field, please, which is in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours and the redemption is yours; buy it for yourself.” Then I knew that this was the word of ADONAI.

9.verse: So I bought the field that was in Anathoth from the son of my uncle Hanamel, and weighed him the money—seventeen shekels of silver.

10.verse: I signed and sealed the deed, called in witnesses, and weighed the money on the scales.

11.verse: Then I took the purchase deed, both the sealed copy, containing the terms and conditions, and the open copy,

12.verse: and I gave the purchase deed to Baruch son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, in the presence of my uncle’s son Hanamel and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the purchase deed, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the guard.

13.verse: Then I charged Baruch before them, saying,

14.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, “Take these deeds—this purchase deed, both the sealed copy and the open copy—and put them in a clay jar, so they may last many days.”

15.verse: For thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Houses and fields and vineyards will yet again be bought in this land.”

16.verse: After I had given the purchase deed to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to ADONAI, saying:

17.verse: “Ah, my Lord ADONAI! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and by Your outstretched arm—nothing is too hard for You!

18.verse: You are the One doing mercy to thousands, but repaying the iniquity of the fathers into the lap of their children after them. Great, mighty God, ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name!

19.verse: Great in counsel and mighty in deed, whose eyes are open to all the ways of the children of men, to give each one according to his ways and according to the fruit of his deeds.

20.verse: You set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and even to this day in Israel and among mankind, and made Yourself a Name, as to this day.

21.verse: You brought your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.

22.verse: You gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.

23.verse: They came in and possessed it. But they did not obey your voice nor walk in your Torah. They have done nothing of all you commanded them to do. Therefore you caused all this evil to fall on them.

24.verse: Look, the siege ramps have just come up to the city to take it. The city has been handed over to the Chaldeans fighting against it, because of the sword, the famine and the pestilence. What You have spoken has happened. Here it is, You see it.

25.verse: Yet You said to me, my Lord ADONAI: ‘Buy for yourself the field for money and call in witnesses’—even as the city is handed over to the Chaldeans.”

26.verse: Then came the word of ADONAI to Jeremiah, saying:

27.verse: “Behold, I am ADONAI, the God of all flesh; is there anything too hard for Me?”

28.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI: “I am about to give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans and Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.

29.verse: Then the Chaldeans fighting against this city will come and set this city on fire and burn it, with the houses—where they burned incense to Baal on their roofs and poured out drink-offerings to other gods, to provoke Me.

30.verse: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done nothing but evil in My sight from their youth; indeed, the children of Israel have done nothing but provoke Me with the work of their hands,” declares ADONAI.

31.verse: “Indeed this city has caused My anger and of My fury from the day that they built it up to this day, so that I will remove it from before My face,

32.verse: because of all the evil the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done to provoke Me—they, their kings, their princes, their kohanim, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

33.verse: “They have turned their back to Me and not their face. Though I taught them early and often, they have not listened to receive instruction.

34.verse: Instead they set up their abominations in the House where My Name is called, to defile it.

35.verse: They built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Ben-Hinnom, to make their sons and their daughters pass through fire to Molech—something I never commanded them, nor did it enter My mind that they would do this loathsome thing, causing Judah to sin.”

36.verse: Now therefore thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, concerning this city, about which you say, “It is handed over to the king of Babylon by the sword, famine, and pestilence.

37.verse: “See, I will gather them out of all the countries, where I have driven them in My anger, My fury, and great wrath, and I will bring them back to this place and cause them to dwell securely.

38.verse: They will be My people, and I will be their God.

39.verse: I will give them one heart and one way, so they may fear Me forever; for their good and for their children after them.

40.verse: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never turn away from doing good for them. I will put My fear in their hearts, so that they will not depart from Me.

41.verse: “Yes, I will delight in doing good for them, and with all My heart and all My soul I will in truth plant them in this land.”

42.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Just as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.

43.verse: So fields will be bought in this land, about which you are saying: ‘It will be a desolation, without man or beast; it is handed over to the Chaldeans.’

44.verse: Men will buy fields for money and sign and seal the deeds and call witnesses in the land of Benjamin and in the areas around Jerusalem, and in the towns of Judah, in the towns of the hill-country, in the towns of the foothills, and in the cities of the South—because I will bring them back from exile.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

1.verse: The Secret of Redemption - Then the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still confined in the guard’s courtyard, saying:

2.verse: Thus says ADONAI the Maker, ADONAI who formed it to make it firm —ADONAI is His Name.

3.verse: “Call to Me, and I will answer you— I will tell you great and hidden things, which you do not know.”

4.verse: For thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “Concerning the houses of this city and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are torn down against the siege ramps and against the sword,

5.verse: they are coming to fight with the Chaldeans, but they are about to fill them with the dead bodies of the people whom I will slay in My anger and in My fury. I have hidden My face from this city because of all their wickedness.

6.verse: “Indeed, I will bring it health and healing, and I will surely heal them. I will reveal to them an abundance of shalom and truth.

7.verse: I will restore Judah from exile and Israel from exile, and will rebuild them, as in former times.

8.verse: I will also cleanse them from all their iniquity in which they have sinned against Me, and I will pardon all their wrongs in which they have sinned against Me and in which they have rebelled against Me.

9.verse: “Then this city will be to Me for a name of joy, praise and glory before all the nations of the earth, which will hear all the good that I do for them, so they will fear and tremble because of all the good and for all the shalom that I do for it.”

10.verse: Voice of the Bridegroom - Thus says ADONAI: “Yet again in this place—which you are saying is a waste without man or beast, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem the desolate, without man, without inhabitant and without beast—there will be heard

11.verse: the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of them who say: ‘Give thanks to ADONAI-Tzva’ot, for ADONAI is good, for His love endures forever!’ as they bring offerings of thanksgiving into the House of ADONAI. For I will restore the land from the exile as it was at first,” declares ADONAI.

12.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Yet again will there be in this place, which is waste, without man and without beast, and in all its cities, a pasture of shepherds making their flocks lie down.

13.verse: In the towns of the hill country, in the towns of the foothills, in the towns of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem and in the towns of Judah, will the flocks again pass under the hands of one who counts them,” declares ADONAI.

14.verse: Righteous Branch of David - “Behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will fulfill the good word I spoke concerning the house of Israel and concerning the house of Judah.

15.verse: In those days and at that time, I will cause a Branch of Righteousness to spring up for David, and He will execute justice and righteousness in the land.

16.verse: In those days will Judah be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell safely. And this is the Name by which He will be called: ADONAI our Righteousness.”

17.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “For David, there will not be cut off a man sitting on the throne of the house of Israel,

18.verse: nor will the Levitical kohanim ever lack a man before Me to offer burnt offering, to burn grain offerings and to make sacrifices continually.”

19.verse: And the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah, saying,

20.verse: thus says ADONAI: “If you can break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that day and night would not be at in their appointed time,

21.verse: only then may My covenant be broken with My servant David, that he would not have a son to reign on his throne, and the Levitical kohanim would not be My ministers.

22.verse: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, nor the sand of the sea measured, so I will multiply the offspring of David My servant, and the Levites who minister to Me.”

23.verse: The word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah, saying:

24.verse: “Have you not noticed what this people have spoken, saying: ‘The two families which ADONAI did choose, He has rejected them’? Thus they despise My people—no longer a nation before them.”

25.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “If I have not made My covenant of day and night firm, and the fixed patterns ordering the heavens and earth,

26.verse: only then would I reject the offspring of Jacob, and of My servant David so that I would not take from his offspring rulers over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will restore them from their exile, and have compassion on them.”

1.verse: Warning to Zedekiah - The word which came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, when King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth of his dominion and all the peoples were warring against Jerusalem and its towns, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “Go, speak to King Zedekiah of Judah and tell him, thus says ADONAI: ‘I am about to give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire,

3.verse: and you will not escape out of his hand, but will surely be captured and given into his hand. Your eyes will behold the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he will speak with you mouth to mouth, and you will go to Babylon.”

4.verse: Yet hear the word of ADONAI, O Zedekiah king of Judah, thus says ADONAI concerning you: “You will not die by the sword;

5.verse: you will die in peace. As there were burning ceremonies for your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will burn spices for you, and they will lament for you: ‘Oy, lord!’ For it is a word I have spoken,” declares ADONAI.

6.verse: Covenant Breaking With Slaves - Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke all these words to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem,

7.verse: when the army of the king of Babylon was warring against Jerusalem and against all the cities of Judah that were left—against Lachish and against Azekah, for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.

8.verse: The word that came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people that were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them,

9.verse: so that everyone should let his manservant and his maidservant—Hebrew man or Hebrew woman—go free, so that no one should make a slave of a Jew, his brother.

10.verse: So all the princes and all the people obeyed, who had entered into the covenant, that everyone would free his manservant and his maidservant and not make them slaves any more—they obeyed, and freed them.

11.verse: But afterward they turned around and made the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, return, and brought them back into subjection as servants and as handmaids.”

12.verse: So the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, saying,

13.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: “I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying:

14.verse: ‘At the end of seven years you are to set free every man his brother that is a Hebrew who has been sold to you and has served you six years; you are let him go free from you.’ But your fathers did not obey Me, nor inclined their ear.

15.verse: Now you had repented, and had done that which is right in My eyes, by proclaiming liberty everyone to his neighbor. You even had made a covenant before Me in the House where My Name is called.

16.verse: But you turned around and profaned My Name, and made everyone his servant and his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their will, return, and you brought them back into subjection, to be your servants and handmaids.”

17.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI: “You have not obeyed Me, to proclaim liberty, everyone to his brother and everyone to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim for you a liberty,” declares ADONAI, “to the sword, to plague and to famine! So I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

18.verse: I will give the men who have transgressed My covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts

19.verse: —the princes of Judah and the princes of Jerusalem, the officers, the kohanim, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf—

20.verse: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of them who seek their life, and their dead bodies will be for food to the birds of the sky and to the beasts of the earth.

21.verse: King Zedekiah of Judah and his princes I will give into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of them who seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, who were withdrawing from you.

22.verse: Indeed, I will command,” declares ADONAI, “and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it, capture it, and burn it down with fire; and I will make the cities of Judah a wasteland, with no one living.”

1.verse: Obedience of Rechabites - The word that came to Jeremiah from ADONAI in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying:

2.verse: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, speak to them, and bring them into one of the chambers of the House of ADONAI, and give them wine to drink.”

3.verse: So I took Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, son of Habazziniah, his brothers and all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites,

4.verse: and I brought them into the House of ADONAI to the chamber of the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah the man of God, which was by the chamber of the princes, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah son of Shallum, the doorkeeper.

5.verse: I set jars full of wine and cups before the sons of the house of the Rechabites, and said to them: “Drink wine!”

6.verse: But they said: “We drink no wine, for Jonadab son of Rechab our father commanded us: ‘You will drink no wine, not you nor your sons, forever.

7.verse: Also you are not to build a house, or sow seed, or plant a vineyard or own one. Instead all your days you are to dwell in tents, so that you may live many days in the land where you sojourn.’

8.verse: So we obeyed the voice of Jonadab son of Rechab our father in all that he charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, nor our daughters,

9.verse: nor to build houses for us to dwell in, nor to own a vineyard, field or seed,

10.verse: and we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.

11.verse: But when King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon came up against the land, we said: ‘Come, let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans and for fear of the army of the Arameans. So we are dwelling in Jerusalem.”

12.verse: Then came the word of ADONAI to Jeremiah, saying,

13.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Go, say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, ‘Will you not receive instruction by listening to My words?’” says ADONAI.

14.verse: “The words of Jonadab son of Rechab, that he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are observed, and to this day they drink none, for they listen to their father’s commandment. Yet I have spoken to you, early and often, and you have not obeyed Me.

15.verse: “I have sent also to you all My servants the prophets, sending them early and often, saying: ‘Return you now every man from his evil way, and amend your doings, and go not after other gods to serve them, and you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers; but you have not inclined your ear, nor listened to Me.

16.verse: For the sons of Jonadab son of Rechab have kept the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people have not obeyed Me.’”

17.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “I am about to bring on Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them, because I spoke to them but they have not heard, and I have called to them but they have not answered.”

18.verse: Now Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Because you have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts, and done according to all that he commanded you,”

19.verse: therefore thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “There will never be cut off for Jonadab son of Rechab a man to stand before Me forever.”

1.verse: Baruch Reads Jeremiah’s Scroll - Now it happened in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of King Josiah of Judah, that this word came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, saying:

2.verse: “Take a megillah scroll, and write in it all the words that I have spoken to you about Israel, about Judah, and about all the nations from the day I spoke to you—from the days of Josiah until this day.

3.verse: Perhaps the house of Judah will hear all the calamity that I am planning to do to them, in order that they may turn, each one from his evil way. Then I would forgive their iniquity and their sin.”

4.verse: So Jeremiah called Baruch son of Neriah, and Baruch wrote from Jeremiah’s mouth, all the words that ADONAI had spoken to him, into a megillah scroll.

5.verse: Then Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying: “I am detained; I cannot go into the House of ADONAI.

6.verse: So you go and read in the megillah—which you have written from my mouth, the words of ADONAI—in the ears of the people, in the House of ADONAI, on a fast day. You should also read them in the ears of all Judah coming from their towns.

7.verse: Perhaps they will present their supplication before ADONAI, and each one will turn from his wicked way. For great is the anger and fury that ADONAI has pronounced against this people.”

8.verse: So Baruch son of Neriah did according to all that the prophet Jeremiah commanded him, reading from the book the words of ADONAI in the House of ADONAI.

9.verse: Now it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim son of King Josiah of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before ADONAI—all the people in Jerusalem and all the people that came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem.

10.verse: Then Baruch read from the scroll the words of Jeremiah in the House of ADONAI, in the chamber of Gemariah son of the scribe Shaphan, in the upper court at the entry of the New Gate of the House of ADONAI, in the ears of all the people.

11.verse: Now when Micaiah son of Gemariah son of Shaphan, had heard from the scroll all the words of ADONAI,

12.verse: he went down to the scribe’s chamber of the king’s palace. All the officials sat there—the scribe Elishama, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the officials.

13.verse: Then Micaiah reported to them all the words that he had heard Baruch reading out of the scroll in the ears of the people.

14.verse: All the officials sent Jehudi son of Nethaniah son of Shelemiah son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying: “Bring in your hand the megillah which you read in the ears of the people and come.” So Baruch son of Neriah brought the megillah in his hand and went to them.

15.verse: Then they said to him: “Sit down now, and read it in our ears.” So Baruch read it in their ears.

16.verse: After they had heard all the words, they turned to each other in fear, then said to Baruch: “We will surely report all these words to the king.”

17.verse: They also asked Baruch, saying: “Tell us now, how did you write all these words? At his dictation?”

18.verse: Then Baruch answered them: “He pronounced all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink into the scroll.”

19.verse: Then the officials said to Baruch: “Go, hide yourself—you and Jeremiah—and let no one know where you are.”

20.verse: Then they went to the king in the courtyard, after they had deposited the megillah in the chamber of the scribe Elishama. They reported all the words in the ears of the king.

21.verse: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the megillah, and he brought it out of the chamber of the scribe Elishama. Jehudi read it in the ears of the king and all the officials who were standing by the king.

22.verse: Since it was the ninth month, the king was residing in the winter house, with a fireplace burning before him.

23.verse: Now as soon as Jehudi had read three or four columns, he cut it with the scribe’s knife and tossed it into the fire that was in the fireplace, until the whole megillah was consumed in the fire in the fireplace.

24.verse: Yet neither the king, nor any of his servants who heard all these words were afraid, nor tore their clothes.

25.verse: Moreover Elnatan, Delaiah and Gemariah entreated the king not to burn the megillah, but he would not listen to them.

26.verse: Then the king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, along with Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to seize the scribe Baruch and the prophet Jeremiah—but ADONAI hid them.

27.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah, after the king had burned the megillah with the words that Baruch had written at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying:

28.verse: “Take yet another megillah, and write in it all the original words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah burned up.

29.verse: About King Jehoiakim of Judah you will say, thus says ADONAI: ‘You have burned this megillah, saying, “Why have you written in it, saying the king of Babylon will surely come and destroy this land and will bring an end to both man and beast from it?” ’”

30.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI about King Jehoiakim of Judah: “He will have no one to sit on the throne of David. Moreover, his dead body will be tossed out to the heat of the day and the frost of the night.

31.verse: I will also punish him and his offspring and his servants for their iniquity, and I will bring on them, and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the people of Judah all the calamity that I have pronounced against them—but they did not listen.”

32.verse: Then Jeremiah took another megillah and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah, who wrote in it from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the scroll which King Jehoiakim of Judah had burned up in the fire—and added to them many similar words.

1.verse: Imprisoned for the Word - Now Zedekiah son of Josiah reigned as king, instead of Coniah son of Jehoiakim, whom King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

2.verse: But neither he nor his servants, nor the people of the land, paid attention to the words of ADONAI which He spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.

3.verse: Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying: “Pray now to ADONAI our God for us.”

4.verse: Now Jeremiah was coming in and going out among the people, for they had not put him into prison.

5.verse: Meanwhile Pharaoh’s army had set out of Egypt, and when the Chaldeans besieging Jerusalem heard the report about them, they lifted the siege from Jerusalem.

6.verse: Then came the word of ADONAI to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

7.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, thus will you say to the king of Judah, who sent you to Me to inquire of Me: “Now, Pharaoh’s army, which is come forth to help you, will return to Egypt into their own land.

8.verse: The Chaldeans will return and fight against this city. Then they will capture it and burn it with fire.”

9.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Do not deceive yourselves, saying: ‘The Chaldeans will surely depart from us’—for they will not depart.

10.verse: For even if you had struck down the entire Chaldean army fighting against you, and there were left among them only wounded men, each in his tent, they would get up and burn this city down with fire.”

11.verse: So it came to pass, when the army of the Chaldeans went up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,

12.verse: that Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin to claim his property there among the people.

13.verse: But when he was at the Benjamin Gate, a captain of the guard was there, whose name was Irijah son of Shelemiah son of Hananiah, who arrested the prophet Jeremiah, saying: “You are deserting to the Chaldeans!”

14.verse: But Jeremiah said, “That’s a lie! I am not deserting to the Chaldeans!” But Irijah would not listen to him, but arrested Jeremiah and brought him to the officials.

15.verse: The officials were angry with Jeremiah, had him beaten, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe, for they had made that the prison.

16.verse: For Jeremiah went into a vaulted cell in the dungeon pit, and Jeremiah remained there many days.

17.verse: Then King Zedekiah sent for him and received him in his palace secretly, and the king asked him: “Is there any word from ADONAI?” “There is,” Jeremiah said, and he also said, “You shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon.”

18.verse: Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah: “How have I sinned against you or against your servants or against this people, that you have put me in prison?

19.verse: Where now are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying: ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or against this land?’

20.verse: So now please listen, my lord the king! Please let my petition come before you and do not make me return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, so I will not die there.”

21.verse: Then Zedekiah the king gave a command, and they committed Jeremiah into the courtyard of the guard. They gave him a loaf of bread from the bakers’ street daily, until all the bread in the city was spent. So Jeremiah stayed in the guard’s courtyard.

1.verse: In a Miry Cistern-Pit - Now Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, Jucal son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah spoke to all the people, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI: “He that remains in this city will die by the sword, by famine, and by plague, but anyone who goes out to the Chaldeans will live—so he will keep his life like the spoils of war, and will live.”

3.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “This city will surely be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.”

4.verse: Then the officials said to the king: “This man should now be put to death, since he demoralizes the men of war remaining in this city as well as all the people, by speaking such words to them. For this man is not seeking the shalom of this people, but calamity.”

5.verse: Then King Zedekiah said: “Here he is in your hand. For the king cannot do anything against you.”

6.verse: So they took Jeremiah and cast him into the cistern-pit of Malchiah the king’s son, which was in the courtyard of the guard, lowering Jeremiah down with ropes. Now in the pit there was no water, but only mud, and Jeremiah sank into the mud.

7.verse: Now Ebed-melech—an Ethiopian official in the king’s palace—heard they had put Jeremiah in the pit. While the king was sitting in the Benjamin Gate,

8.verse: Ebed-melech went out from the king’s palace and spoke to the king, saying:

9.verse: “My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they cast into the pit. He is likely to die right where he is from hunger, for there is no more bread in the city.”

10.verse: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying: “Take thirty men from here with you, and bring the prophet Jeremiah up out of the cistern, before he dies.”

11.verse: So Ebed-melech took the men with him and went into the king’s palace under the storehouse, from there he took worn-out clothes and worn-out rags, and lowered them by ropes into the cistern-pit to Jeremiah.

12.verse: And Ebed-melech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah: “Now put these worn-out clothes and rags under your armpits under the ropes.” Jeremiah did so.

13.verse: Then they pulled Jeremiah up with the ropes, and lifted him up out of the pit. But Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.

14.verse: Then Zedekiah the king sent for the prophet Jeremiah and received him at the third entrance in the House of ADONAI. The king said to Jeremiah: “I am going to ask you something—hide nothing from me.”

15.verse: Jeremiah said to Zedekiah: “If I tell you, won’t you surely put me to death? Besides, if I give you counsel, you won’t listen to me.”

16.verse: So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying: “As ADONAI lives, that gave us life, I will not put you to death, nor will I give you into the hand of these men seeking your life.”

17.verse: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah: Thus says ADONAI, Elohim-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “If you will go out to the officers of the king of Babylon, then your soul will live, this city will not be burned with fire; and you and your household will survive.
