18.verse: But if you do not go out to the officers of the king of Babylon, then this city will be handed over to the Chaldeans; they will burn it with fire, and you will not escape out of their hand.”

19.verse: Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah: “I am afraid of the Judeans who have deserted to the Chaldeans, lest they hand me over to them and they abuse me.”

20.verse: But Jeremiah said: “They will not hand you over. Please, obey the voice of ADONAI, in what I am speaking to you, so it will go well for you, and your soul will live!

21.verse: But if you keep refusing to go out, this is the word that ADONAI has shown me:

22.verse: ‘Soon, all the women who are left in the palace of the king of Judah will be brought out to the officers of the king of Babylon, and those women will say: “Your close friends have misled you, and prevailed over you. Your feet are sunk in the mire, and they deserted you.’”

23.verse: “Then they will bring out all your wives and your children to the Chaldeans, and you shall not escape out of their hand, but shall be seized by the hand of the king of Babylon, and this city will be burned down with fire.”

24.verse: Then said Zedekiah to Jeremiah: “Let no one know of these words, and you will not die.

25.verse: “But if the officials hear that I have talked with you, and they come to you and say to you: ‘Tell us now what you have said to the king—hide nothing from us and we will not put you to death. And what did the king say to you?’

26.verse: Then you will tell them, ‘I was presenting my petition before the king, not to make me return to Jonathan’s house to die there.’”

27.verse: When all the officials came to Jeremiah and questioned him, he told them with just these words that the king had commanded. So they stopped speaking with him, since the matter was not overheard.

28.verse: Then Jeremiah stayed in the guard’s courtyard until the day that Jerusalem was captured.

1.verse: Judgment on Zedekiah and Jerusalem - Now when Jerusalem was captured, in the ninth year of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the tenth month, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and all his army advanced against Jerusalem, and besieged it.

2.verse: On the ninth day of the fourth month of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the city wall was broken through.

3.verse: Then all the officials of the king of Babylon came in and sat in the Middle Gate: Nergal-sarezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim the Rab-saris, Nergal-sarezer the Rab-mag, and all the rest of the officials of Babylon’s king.

4.verse: Now when King Zedekiah of Judah and all the men of war saw them, they fled. They went out of the city at night, by way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the two walls, heading out toward the way of the Arabah.

5.verse: But the Chaldean army pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. When they captured him, they brought him up to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he passed judgment on him.

6.verse: The king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes. Moreover, the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.

7.verse: Then he blinded Zedekiah’s eyes, and he bound him in shackles to carry him off to Babylon.

8.verse: Then the Chaldeans burned the king’s palace and the houses of the people with fire, and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.

9.verse: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away into exile the rest of the people—those who remained in the city and also the deserters who had defected to him, and the rest of the people remaining.

10.verse: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left some of the poorest of the people, who had nothing, behind in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields in that day.

11.verse: Vindication of Jeremiah - Now King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon gave orders about Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying:

12.verse: “Take him, and look after him, and do no harm to him; rather, do to him just as he tells you.”

13.verse: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent word, so Nebushazban the Rab-saris, Nergal-sarezer the Rab-mag and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon

14.verse: sent and brought Jeremiah out of the guard’s courtyard, and gave him to Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, to take him home. So he dwelt among the people.

15.verse: Now the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the guard’s courtyard, saying,

16.verse: “Go, speak to Eved-melech the Ethiopian, saying, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: ‘Listen, I will bring about My words on this city for evil and not for good. They will happen before you in that day.

17.verse: But I will deliver you in that day—it is a declaration of ADONAI—and you will not be given into the hand of the men whom you dread.

18.verse: “For I will surely rescue you, so you will not fall by the sword. But you will keep your life as spoils, because you put your trust in Me.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

1.verse: Jeremiah Returns to Judah - The word which came to Jeremiah from ADONAI, after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had released him from Ramah. He had taken him bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, who were being exiled to Babylon.

2.verse: Now the captain of the guard had taken Jeremiah and said to him: “ADONAI your God pronounced this evil against this place,

3.verse: and ADONAI brought it about and did just as He said. Because you have sinned against ADONAI and have not listened to His voice, this thing has happened to you.

4.verse: But now behold, I am freeing you this day from the chains that are on your hand. If it is good in your eyes to come with me to Babylon, come, and I will look after you. But if it is evil in your eyes to come with me to Babylon, stop. Look, the whole land is before you—wherever it seems good and right to you to go, there go.”

5.verse: But he would not turn back. “Go back then to Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people; or go anywhere it seems right in your eyes to go.” Then the captain of the guard gave him a ration and a gift, and let him go.

6.verse: So Jeremiah went to the son of Ahikam to Mizpah, and dwelt with him among the people that were left in the land.

7.verse: Gedaliah Appointed Governor - Now all the commanders of the forces that were in the field—they and their men—heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam over the land, and had put him in charge of the men, and women and children, the poorest of the land who were not carried away captive to Babylon.

8.verse: So they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—including Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan sons of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah son of the Maacathite—they and their men.

9.verse: Then Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan swore to them and to their men, saying: “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Stay in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well for you.

10.verse: As for me, look, I will dwell at Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who come to us. But as for you, gather wine, summer fruit and oil, and put them in your jars, and dwell in your cities that you have taken over.”

11.verse: Also when all the Jews who were in Moab, among Ammon’s children, in Edom, and in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had appointed over them Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan,

12.verse: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they had been driven, and came back to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruit in great abundance.

13.verse: Then Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were in the field came to Gedaliah to Mizpah

14.verse: and said to him, “Are you aware that Baalis the king of Ammon’s children has sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah to take your life?” But Gedaliah son of Ahikam did not believe them.

15.verse: Then Johanan son of Kareah spoke privately to Gedaliah at Mizpah, saying, “Let me go now, and I will slay Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and no one will know it. Why should he take your life, so that all the Jews that are gathered to you would be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?’

16.verse: But Gedaliah son of Ahikam said to Johanan son of Kareah, “Don’t do this thing! For what you are saying about Ishmael is a lie.”

1.verse: Gedaliah Assassinated - Now it was in the seventh month, that Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama—of royal descent and one of the chief officers of the king, along with ten men—came to Gedaliah son of Ahikam to Mizpah. While they were eating bread there together in Mizpah,

2.verse: Ishmael son of Nethaniah rose up with the ten men that were with him and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan with the sword—putting to death the one whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.

3.verse: Ishmael also slew all the Jews who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, as well as the Chaldean soldiers who were found there.

4.verse: Now it was the next day after he had slain Gedaliah, when no one knew about it,

5.verse: that 80 men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, with their beards shaved off, their clothes rent, and having gashed themselves, with grain offerings and frankincense in their hand to bring to the House of ADONAI.

6.verse: So Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went, and as he came to meet them, he said to them: “Come to Gedaliah son of Ahikam.”

7.verse: Yet it was that as soon as they came within of the city that Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the men with him slaughtered them within the cistern-pit.

8.verse: However ten men were found among them that said to Ishmael: “Don’t kill us! For we have hidden stores in the field—wheat, barley, oil and honey!” So he held off and did not kill them along with their companions.

9.verse: Now the cistern where Ishmael cast all the corpses of the men whom he killed, because they were on Gedaliah’s side, was the one which King Asa had made for fear of King Baasa of Israel. Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.

10.verse: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the rest of the people that were in Mizpah, including the king’s daughters—all the people who were left in Mizpah over whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had put under the charge of Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and set off to cross over to Ammon’s children.

11.verse: But Johanan son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the forces that were with him heard about all the evil that Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done.

12.verse: So they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great pool in Gibeon.

13.verse: Now when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were with him, they were glad.

14.verse: So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned around and came back, and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.

15.verse: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to Ammon’s children.

16.verse: Then Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were with him took all the remnant of the people whom he had rescued from Ishmael son of Nethaniah from Mizpah, after he had murdered Gedaliah son of Ahikam—the men, the soldiers, women, children, and court officials whom he had brought back from Gibeon—

17.verse: and they left and stayed at Chimham’s lodge, which is near Beth-lehem, in order to go on to enter Egypt,

18.verse: away from the Chaldeans. For they were afraid of them, since Ishmael son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.

1.verse: Warning Against Flight to Egypt - Then all the commanders of the forces, Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least to the greatest, approached

2.verse: and said to the prophet Jeremiah, “Please, let our petition be presented before you, and pray to ADONAI your God on our behalf, for all this remnant—for we who are left are but a few out of many, as you are seeing with your own eyes—

3.verse: that ADONAI your God may tell us the way we should go and what we should do.”

4.verse: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them: “I have heard you. Agreed: I will pray to ADONAI your God according to your words, and it will be that every word ADONAI will answer you, I will declare it to you—I will not keep a word from you.”

5.verse: Then they said to Jeremiah: “Let ADONAI be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act in accord with every word that ADONAI your God sends you to us.

6.verse: Whether it be good or evil, we will obey the voice of ADONAI our God, to whom we are sending you, so that it may go well with us, when we obey the voice of ADONAI our God.”

7.verse: Now it was at the end of ten days that the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah.

8.verse: Then he called Johanan son of Kareah, and all the commanders of the forces that were with him, and all the people from the least to the greatest,

9.verse: and said to them, “Thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before Him:

10.verse: ‘If you will still stay in this land, then will I build you up and not tear you down, and I will plant you and not uproot you. For I will relent concerning the calamity that I have done to you.

11.verse: Do not be not afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you dread—do not be afraid of him”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“for I am with you to save you, and deliver you from his hand.

12.verse: I will also show you compassion and he will have compassion on you, and restore you to your own soil.

13.verse: But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land,’ so that you do not obey the voice of ADONAI your God,

14.verse: saying: ‘No, instead we’ll go into the land of Egypt, where we will see no war or hear the sound of a shofar or hunger for food, and live there’

15.verse: now therefore hear the word of ADONAI, O remnant of Judah, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: If you really set your faces to enter Egypt, and go to sojourn there,

16.verse: then it will come to pass that the sword, which you fear will overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine about which you are anxious will follow hard after you there in Egypt—and there you will die.

17.verse: So will it be for all the people who set their faces to enter Egypt to sojourn there—they will die by the sword, by famine and by plague. So none of them will remain or escape from the calamity that I will bring on them.’”

18.verse: For thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “As My anger and My fury were poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My fury be poured out on you, if you will enter Egypt. You will be an execration, a horror, a curse, and a disgrace, and you will never see this place again.”

19.verse: ADONAI has spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah: “Do not go to Egypt. Know for sure that I have forewarned you this day!

20.verse: For you have led your own souls in error, since it was you who sent me to ADONAI your God, saying: ‘Pray to ADONAI our God on our behalf, and in accord with all that ADONAI our God will say, so declare to us, and we will do it.

21.verse: So I have this day declared it to you, but you will not obey the voice of ADONAI your God in anything for which He has sent me to you.

22.verse: Now therefore know for sure that you will die by the sword, by famine, and by plague, in the place whither you desired to go to sojourn there.”

1.verse: Chaldeans Invade Egypt - But when Jeremiah had made an end of telling all the people all the words of ADONAI their God—all these words for which ADONAI their God had sent him to them—

2.verse: then Azariah son of Hoshaiah, Johanan son of Kareah, and all the insolent men responded, saying to Jeremiah: “You are telling a lie! ADONAI our God has not sent you to say. ‘You must not go to Egypt to sojourn there.’

3.verse: Rather, Baruch son of Neriah is inciting you against us, to give us over into the hand of the Chaldeans, so they may put us to death or carry us away as captives to Babylon!”

4.verse: So Johanan son of Kareah, all the commanders of the forces and all the people, did not obey the voice of ADONAI, to stay in the land of Judah.

5.verse: But Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces took the entire remnant of Judah who had returned from all the nations where they had been driven to dwell in the land of Judah—

6.verse: the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters, everyone that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, as well as Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah—

7.verse: and they went to the land of Egypt. For they did not obey the voice of ADONAI. When they arrived at Tahpanhes

8.verse: the word of ADONAI came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

9.verse: “Take some large stones in your hand and hide them in the mortar in the brickwork at the entrance of Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah.

10.verse: Then say to them, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “I am about to send for and bring King Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, My servant, and I will set his throne over these stones where I have hid, and he will spread his royal pavilion over them.

11.verse: Yes, he will come, and will strike the land of Egypt. Those for death—to death! Those for exile—to exile! Those for the sword—to the sword!

12.verse: “I will also set fire to the houses of Egypt’s gods. He will burn them and carry them off. He will wrap himself up with the land of Egypt as a shepherd wraps himself up with his garment. Then he will depart from there victoriously.

13.verse: “He will also shatter the pillars of the temple of the sun in the land of Egypt, while houses of the gods of Egypt He will burn with fire.”

1.verse: Calamity in Egypt - The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews dwelling in the land of Egypt—at Migdol, at Tahpanhes, at Noph, and in the region of Pathros, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “You have seen all the calamity that I brought on Jerusalem and on all the cities of Judah. Behold, today they are a ruin, and no one lives in them,

3.verse: because of their wickedness which they committed to provoke Me, by continuing to burn sacrifices for and serve other gods, whom they had not known—not they, nor you, nor your fathers.

4.verse: Yet I sent you all My servants the prophets, sending them early and often, saying: ‘Oh, do not do this loathsome thing that I hate.’

5.verse: But they did not listen or incline their ear to turn from their wickedness, to stop making offering to other gods.

6.verse: “Therefore My fury and Mine anger was poured out and blazed in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. So they are waste and a ruin, as it is today.

7.verse: So now, thus says ADONAI, Elohim-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Why are you committing this great evil against your own souls? You cut off from yourselves man and woman, infant and nursing child, from the midst of Judah, to leave yourself without a remnant.

8.verse: You are provoking Me with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you have come to dwell, so that you will be cut off and become a curse and a disgrace among all the nations of the earth.

9.verse: Have you forgotten the evils of your fathers, the evils of the kings of Judah, the evils of their wives, and your own evils and the evils of your wives, which were committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

10.verse: They have not become contrite even to this day, nor have they feared nor walked in My Torah, My statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.”

11.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “I will soon set My face against you for calamity, to cut off all Judah.

12.verse: I will take the remnant of Judah who set their faces to enter the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they will all be consumed, falling in the land of Egypt by the sword and by famine. They will die, from the least to the greatest, by the sword and by famine, and they will be an execration, and a horror, a curse, and a disgrace.

13.verse: So I will punish those dwelling in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by famine, and by plague.

14.verse: So none of the remnant of Judah entering the land of Egypt to sojourn there will escape or remain, to return to the land of Judah, when they are longing with their soul to return to live there; for none will return except as refugees.”

15.verse: Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, along with all the women that stood by—a large assembly—with all the people dwelling in Pathros in the land of Egypt, responded to Jeremiah, saying:

16.verse: “As for the word that you spoke to us in the Name of ADONAI, we are not going to listen to you!

17.verse: Instead we will definitely do every word as went out of our mouth—burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, just as we did, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem—for then we had plenty of food, were well off, and saw no calamity.

18.verse: But since we stopped burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been consumed by the sword and by famine.

19.verse: Moreover, when we were burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, when we made cakes for her in her image and poured out drink offerings to her, were we without our husbands?”

20.verse: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, to the men and the women, to all the people that were giving him such an answer, saying:

21.verse: “The incense-burning that you offered in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem—you and your fathers, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—ADONAI did remember them, they did come into His heart.

22.verse: Then ADONAI could no longer endure it, because of the evil of your deeds, because of the abominations that you committed! So your land has become a wasteland, a desolation and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.

23.verse: Because you have burned incense, because you have sinned against ADONAI and have not listened to the voice of ADONAI, nor walked in His Torah, nor in His statutes, nor in His testimonies—that is why this calamity has befallen you, as it is this day.”

24.verse: Moreover Jeremiah said to all the people and to all the women: “Hear the word of ADONAI, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt.

25.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, saying: ‘You and your wives have both spoken with your mouths and fulfilled it with your hands, saying: “We will definitely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink-offerings to her.” You surely will confirm your vows and surely will perform your vows!’”

26.verse: Therefore hear the word of ADONAI, all Judah dwelling in the land of Egypt: “Behold, I have sworn by My great Name,” declares ADONAI, “never more will My Name be invoked in the mouth of anyone of Judah in all the land of Egypt saying: ‘As my Lord ADONAI lives.’

27.verse: Here I am, watching over them for evil, and not for good. All the people of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will be consumed by the sword and by famine, until there is an end of them.

28.verse: Those escaping the sword will return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah only few in number. Then the remnant of Judah who entered the land of Egypt to sojourn there, will know whose word stands up—Mine or theirs!” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

29.verse: “Moreover, this will be the sign to you: I will visit punishment on you in this place, so that you may know that My words will surely stand against you as calamity.”

30.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Soon, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of them who seek his life, just as I gave King Zedekiah of Judah into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, his enemy who was seeking his life.”

1.verse: Message for Baruch - The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a scroll from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

2.verse: thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel, concerning you, Baruch: “you said:

3.verse: ‘Oy to me now! For ADONAI has added sorrow to my pain. I am worn out with my groaning, and I find no rest.’”

4.verse: Thus shall you say to him, thus says ADONAI: “Behold, what I have built I will tear down, and what I have planted I will uproot—the whole land.

5.verse: But you, are you expecting great things for yourself? Seek no more! For I am about to bring calamity on all flesh”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“but I will grant you your soul as spoil in all places where you may go.”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Egypt - The word of ADONAI that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the nations.

2.verse: For Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah.

3.verse: “Arrange breastplate and shield! Advance to battle!

4.verse: Harness the horses and mount, O horsemen! Take your position, with helmets! Polish the spears! Put on armor!

5.verse: Why have I seen them? They are shattered, retreating, their warriors beaten, fleeing for cover, no turning back, terror on every side!” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

6.verse: “The swift cannot flee, nor the warrior escape. In the north by the river Euphrates they stumbled and fell.

7.verse: Who is this, rising like the Nile, like the rivers whose waters churn?

8.verse: Egypt rises like the Nile, like the rivers whose waters churn. He says: ‘I will rise up, I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city and its inhabitants!’

9.verse: Prance, you horses, and rush madly, you chariots. Let the warriors go out— Cush and Put grasping the shield, Lydians grasping and bending the bow!

10.verse: For that day belongs to my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot, as a day of vengeance, to avenge Himself against His foes. The sword will devour and be satisfied and will drink its fill of their blood. For it will be a sacrifice for my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot, in the northern land by the river Euphrates.

11.verse: Go up into Gilead and get balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt. In vain you use many medicines— there is no cure for you.

12.verse: Nations have heard of your shame, and your outcry fills the earth. For warrior stumbles over warrior— both fall down together.”

13.verse: The word that ADONAI spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt:

14.verse: “Declare it in Egypt, proclaim in Migdol, and announce in Noph and Tahpanhes. Say: ‘Stand up and get ready! For the sword has devoured all around you.

15.verse: Why are your strong ones swept away? They did not stand up, because ADONAI thrust him down.

16.verse: They keep stumbling, yes, falling over each other. Then they said: ‘Get up! Let’s return to our own people, to the land of our birth, away from the oppressor’s sword.’

17.verse: They cried there: ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise! He let the opportune time pass.’

18.verse: As I live,” declares the King —whose Name is ADONAI-Tzva’ot— “like Tabor among the mountains, or like Carmel by the sea, so surely he will come.”

19.verse: O daughter dwelling in Egypt, get your bags ready for exile! For Noph will become a ruin laid waste, uninhabited.

20.verse: Egypt is a beautiful heifer— but a biting fly is coming— from the north it is coming!

21.verse: Even her mercenaries among her are like stall-fed calves, for they also will turn back— they will flee away together, they will not stand up— for the day of their calamity has come upon them, the time of their visitation.

22.verse: Its sound will hiss like a snake, as they march with an army, and come against her as woodcutters with axes.

23.verse: They cut down her forest” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “though it was impenetrable, for they are worse than the locust —they are without number.

24.verse: The daughter of Egypt is disgraced, handed over to people of the north.”

25.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish Amon of No, Pharaoh, Egypt, with her gods and her kings—even Pharaoh, and them that trust in him.

26.verse: I will hand them over to those seeking their lives, into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and his servants. Yet afterwards it will be inhabited, as in the days of old.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

27.verse: “But you, fear not, Jacob My servant, nor be dismayed, O Israel. For behold, I will save you from afar, your offspring from the land of their exile. And Jacob will return and be at peace and secure, no one frightening him.

28.verse: Fear not, Jacob My servant” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “for I am with you. I will make a full end of all the nations where I have driven you, but I will not make a full end of you. I will discipline you with justice, but will not utterly destroy you.”

1.verse: Prophecy Against the Philistines - The word of ADONAI that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck Gaza.

2.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Look, waters rising from the north will become an overflowing torrent, and overflow the land and all in it, the city and those dwelling in it and the men will cry, and every inhabitant of the land wail.

3.verse: The noise— the stomping hooves of his stallions, the rumbling of his chariots, the reverberation of his wheels! Fathers will not turn back for their children because of their limp hands.

4.verse: For the day is coming to devastate all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every remaining ally. For ADONAI will destroy the Philistines, the rest of the island of Caphtor.

5.verse: Baldness has come upon Gaza, Ashkelon is ruined. O remnant of their valley, how long will you gash yourself?

6.verse: O sword of ADONAI, how long until you are quiet? Go back into your sheath, rest and be still.

7.verse: How can you be quiet when ADONAI has commanded? He has assigned it against Ashkelon and against the coast of the sea.

1.verse: Prophecy Against Moab - Concerning Moab, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Oy to Nebo! For it will be ravaged. Kiriathaim will be disgraced and captured. The fortress will be shamed, shattered.

2.verse: There is no more praise for Moab. In Heshbon they plotted evil against her: ‘Come, let’s cut her off as a nation.’ You too, Madmen, will be silenced— the sword will chase you.

3.verse: The sound of outcry from Horonaim, devastation and great destruction!

4.verse: Moab is shattered— her little ones have raised a cry to be heard.

5.verse: For at the ascent of Luhith they go up with continual weeping. For on the descent to Horonaim they heard the foe’s shattering cry.

6.verse: Flee! Escape with your lives! Be like a tamarisk in the wilderness.

7.verse: For because of your trust in your works and your treasures, you will be captured, too. Chemosh will go into exile, together with his priests and princes.

8.verse: The destroyer will come to every town. No town will escape. The valley will perish and the plain will be destroyed, as ADONAI has said.

9.verse: Give wings to Moab, for she must fly and get away. Her cities will become a wasteland, with no one living in them.

10.verse: Cursed is the one who does the work of ADONAI with slackness, and cursed is the one who withholds his sword from blood.

11.verse: Moab has been at ease since his youth. He has settled like wine on its dregs. He has not been emptied from jar to jar, nor gone into exile. Therefore he retains his flavor, and his aroma has not changed.

12.verse: Therefore behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will send to him those who will tip him up and over, and they will empty his vessels, and smash his jars in pieces.

13.verse: So Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh just as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel their confidence.

14.verse: How can you say: ‘We are warriors and men valiant for battle’?

15.verse: Moab is ravaged, its towns entered, its choice young men gone down to slaughter” —It is a declaration of the King, whose Name is ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

16.verse: “Moab’s calamity will come soon, and his downfall hastens swiftly.

17.verse: Mourn for him, all who are around him, all who know his name. Say: ‘How the mighty scepter, the splendid rod, is broken!’

18.verse: O daughter dwelling in Dibon come down from your glory and sit in thirst! For Moab’s destroyer has come to you. He has devastated your strongholds.

19.verse: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the road and watch— ask him fleeing and her escaping, ‘What has happened?’

20.verse: Moab is disgraced, indeed shattered. Wail and shriek! Declare by the Arnon, Moab is ruined!

21.verse: Judgment has come on the tableland —on Holon, Jahzah, Mephaath,

22.verse: on Dibon, Nebo, Beth-diblathaim,

23.verse: on Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, Beth-meon,

24.verse: on Kerioth, Bozrah, and all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.

25.verse: The horn of Moab is cut off and his arm is broken!” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

26.verse: “Make him drunk, for he exalted himself against ADONAI. So Moab will wallow in his vomit and also become a laughingstock.

27.verse: After all, Israel is a laughingstock to you. Was he ever found among thieves, that whenever you speak of him, you should wag the head?

28.verse: Inhabitants of Moab, leave the towns and dwell in crags— like a dove nesting in a cave’s mouth.

29.verse: We have heard of the pride of Moab —very proud he is—his haughtiness, his arrogance, his insolence, and his self-exalted heart.

30.verse: I know his arrogance,” says ADONAI, “but it is dishonest— his boasts really accomplish nothing.

31.verse: Therefore I wail for Moab! Yes, I cry out for all Moab, for the men of Kir-heres I moan.

32.verse: More than weeping of Jazer will I weep for you, vine of Sibmah! Your branches spread to the sea, reached as far as the sea of Jazer. On your summer fruits and your vintage the destroyer has fallen.

33.verse: So joy and gladness are taken away from the fruitful field and from the land of Moab. I stopped wine from the winepresses. No one will tread with shouting— any shouting is not a shout of joy.”

34.verse: “From the outcry of Heshbon to Elealeh, as far as Jahaz they will raise their voice—from Zoar to Horonaim and a 3-year old heifer—for the Waters of Nimrim also will be waste.

35.verse: Moreover I will make an end in Moab”—it is a declaration of ADONAI—“of the one offering on the high place and the one burning incense to his gods.”

36.verse: “That is why my heart is moaning like funeral flutes for Moab, and my heart moans like flutes for the people of Kir-heres. Thus the wealth he made is lost.

37.verse: For every head is bald, every beard clipped, on all the hands are gashes, and around the waist sackcloth.

38.verse: On all the housetops of Moab and in its squares— lamentation everywhere! For I have broken Moab like a jar In which no one delights” —it is a declaration of ADONAI—

39.verse: “‘How shattered it is!’ they wailed! ‘How Moab turned his back in shame!’ So Moab will become a laughingstock and a horror to all around him.”

40.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Behold, he will swoop down like a vulture and spread out his wings against Moab.

41.verse: The towns are captured, the strongholds seized. The hearts of Moab’s warriors in that day will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

42.verse: Moab will be destroyed as a people, because he boasted against ADONAI.

43.verse: Panic, pit and trap, are upon you, inhabitant of Moab,” declares ADONAI.

44.verse: “The one who flees from panic will fall into the pit, and one who climbs out of the pit will be caught in the trap. For I will bring on Moab the year of their visitation.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

45.verse: “In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stop, exhausted, for fire breaks out of Heshbon flame from within Sihon, and it singes the foreheads and the scalps of Moab’s noisy sons.

46.verse: Oy to you, Moab! The people of Chemosh have perished! For your sons are taken away captive and your daughters into exile.

47.verse: Yet I will restore Moab from exile in the end of days.” It is a declaration of ADONAI. “Until then this is the judgment of Moab.”

1.verse: Against Surrounding Nations - About Ammon’s children, thus says ADONAI: “Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then did Malcam dispossess Gad and his people settled in its towns?

2.verse: Therefore behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will sound an alarm of war heard against Rabbah of Ammon! It will become a mound of ruins. Her villages will be burned with fire. Then Israel will dispossess those who dispossessed him.” it is a declaration of ADONAI.

3.verse: “Wail, Heshbon, for Ai is devastated! Cry, daughters of Rabbah! Wear sackcloth, lament, and run to and fro within the walls, for Malcam will go into captivity together with his priests and princes.

4.verse: Why do you brag about valleys— your flowing valley, faithless daughter? Trusting in your treasures: ‘Who will come against me?’

5.verse: I am about to bring terror on you” —a declaration of my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot— “from all those around you. Each of you will be banished headlong, with no one to gather the fugitives.

6.verse: Yet afterward I will restore Ammon’s children from exile.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

7.verse: About Edom, thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Is there no longer wisdom in Teman? Is counsel lost to the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?

8.verse: Flee! Turn back! Stay low, inhabitants of Dedan, for I will bring Esau’s calamity on him at the time that I punish him.

9.verse: If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave gleanings? If thieves came at night, would they not destroy only enough for themselves?

10.verse: But I will strip Esau bare. I will uncover his hiding places, so he will not be able to hide himself. His offspring has been destroyed with his kinsmen and neighbors. So he is nothing.

11.verse: Leave your orphans—I will keep them alive, and let your widows trust in Me.”

12.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Behold, if those who do not deserve to drink the cup must surely drink, can you go utterly unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for you shall surely drink!

13.verse: For I have sworn by Myself” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “that Bozrah will become a horror, a disgrace, a waste and a curse. All its towns will be ruins forever.”

14.verse: I heard a message from ADONAI. An ambassador is sent to the nations: ‘Gather together, come against her, and rise up for war!’

15.verse: For see, I made you least among nations, despised among men.

16.verse: Your terrorism has deceived you, so that your heart is arrogant. You who live in the clefts of the rock, who occupy the height of the hill. Though you make your nest as high as an eagle’s, I will bring you down from there.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

17.verse: “Edom will become a desolation. Everyone passing by will be appalled and hiss at all its plagues.

18.verse: Like the overthrow of Sodom, Gomorrah and their neighbors,” says ADONAI, “no one will live there, nor any son of man dwell there.

19.verse: Look, it is like a lion coming up from the thickets of the Jordan to a secure pasture— for abruptly I will make him run away from it. I appoint over it whomever I choose. For who is like Me? Who will summon me to court? What shepherd stands up to Me?”

20.verse: Therefore hear the plan that ADONAI has drawn up against Edom, and His strategies that He designed against the inhabitants of Teman. Surely the least of the flock will be dragged away, Surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.

21.verse: The earth will tremble at the noise of their downfall. The sound of their outcry will be heard at the Sea of Reeds.

22.verse: Behold, he will mount up and swoop down like an eagle, and spread out his wings against Bozrah. The hearts of Edom’s warriors in that day will be like a woman’s heart in her pangs.

23.verse: About Damascus: Hamath and Arpad are ashamed, for they heard bad news, They melt away; in the sea there is trouble that cannot be quiet.

24.verse: Damascus has become feeble. She turns away to flee, panic grips her, anguish and pangs have seized her, like a woman in travail.

25.verse: How is the city of praise deserted— the city of my joy?

26.verse: Therefore her young men will fall in her squares— all the warriors will be silenced in that day. It is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

27.verse: “I will set fire to the wall of Damascus— it will devour Ben-hadad’s palaces.”

28.verse: About Kedar and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck. Thus says ADONAI: “Arise, go up against Kedar and devastate the children of the east.

29.verse: They will take away their tents and their flocks. They will carry away their curtains, all their gear and their camels. They will cry out against them, ‘Terror on every side!’

30.verse: Flee! Scatter far! Stay low, inhabitants of Hazor!” It is a declaration of ADONAI. “For King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and devised a plan against you.

31.verse: Arise, go up against a nation at ease, dwelling securely,” says ADONAI. “They have no gates or bars; they dwell alone.

32.verse: Their camels will become plunder, their many cattle a spoil. I will scatter to all the winds those who shave the edges. I bring their calamity from every side.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

33.verse: “Hazor will be a lair of jackals, a desolation forever— no one will abide there, nor any son of man dwell there.”

34.verse: The word of ADONAI that came to the prophet Jeremiah about Elam, at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, saying,

35.verse: thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Behold, I will break Elam’s bow— the source of their might.

36.verse: I will bring upon Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them to all those winds. There will be no nation where the dispersed of Elam will not go.

37.verse: I will shatter Elam before their enemies and before those seeking their soul. I will bring calamity on them— My burning anger!” It is a declaration of ADONAI, “I will send the sword after them until I have consumed them.

38.verse: Then I will put My throne in Elam and destroy from it king and princes.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

39.verse: “Yet it will be in the end of days, that I will restore Elam from exile.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

1.verse: Against Babylon - The word that ADONAI spoke about Babylon, about the land of the Chaldeans, through Jeremiah the prophet:

2.verse: “Declare it among the nations and proclaim! Raise a banner, announce, hide nothing! Say: ‘Babylon will be captured, Bel put to shame, Merodach dismayed, her images disgraced, her idols shattered!’

3.verse: For a nation comes up against her out of the land of the north —it will desolate her land. No one will dwell there— they have fled, gone, both man and beast.”

4.verse: Declaration of Restoration - “In those days and at that time” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “the children of Israel will come, together with the children of Judah, weeping as they come, and will seek ADONAI their God.

5.verse: They will ask about Zion, the way— here are their faces! Come! They will join themselves to ADONAI in an everlasting covenant that will never be forgotten.

6.verse: My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds led them astray. Turning around in the mountains, they went from mountain to hill, and forgot their resting place.

7.verse: Everyone finding them devoured them. Their foes said: ‘We’re not guilty!’ Instead, they sinned against ADONAI, the habitation of justice— ADONAI, the hope of their fathers.”

8.verse: Doom of Babylon - “Flee from within Babylon, get out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be like he-goats before the flock.

9.verse: For I will soon stir up and bring against Babylon an alliance of great nations from the north. They will form battle lines against her, from there she will be captured. Their arrows will be like a warrior who bereaves, not returning empty.

10.verse: Chaldea will be a spoil— all who plunder her will be satisfied.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

11.verse: “Because you rejoice, because you exult— you who plunder My inheritance— because you frolic like a trampling heifer and neigh like stallions,

12.verse: your mother will be utterly ashamed, she who bore you will be humiliated. Behold, the least of the nations will be a wilderness, a dry land, a desert.”

13.verse: Because of ADONAI’s wrath, it will be uninhabited, all waste. Everyone who passes by Babylon will be appalled, hissing at all her wounds.

14.verse: Array against Babylon all around, all you who bend the bow. Shoot at her! Spare no arrows— for she has sinned against ADONAI.

15.verse: Raise a war cry against her all around! She has thrown up her hands, her bulwarks are fallen, her walls thrown down. For it is ADONAI’s vengeance: take vengeance on her, as she has done, do to her!

16.verse: Cut off the sower from Babylon and the one who wields a sickle in the time of harvest. Before the sword of the oppressor they will each turn to his people, each will flee to his own land.

17.verse: Israel is a scattered flock— lions have driven them away. First, Assyria’s king devoured him. This last one who broke his bones was King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.

18.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “Indeed, I will punish Babylon’s king and his land, just as I punished Assyria’s king.

19.verse: I will bring Israel back to his pasture. He will feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.

20.verse: In those days and in that time” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “Israel’s guilt will be sought, but there will be none, also for the sins of Judah, but they will not be found. For I will pardon those whom I leave as a remnant.

21.verse: Go up against the land of Merathaim, against the inhabitants of Pekod. Put them to the sword and utterly destroy them” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “and do all that I commanded you.”

22.verse: The noise of battle is in the land and great crashing.

23.verse: How the hammer of the whole earth has been cut down and smashed! How Babylon has become a horror among the nations!

24.verse: I set a snare for you, so you were caught, O Babylon, when you were unaware. You were found and also caught, because you challenged ADONAI.

25.verse: ADONAI has opened His armory and brought out the weapons of His indignation. For it is a work that my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot has to do in the land of Chaldea.

26.verse: Come against her from afar, open her granaries, pile her up like heaps and utterly destroy her! Let nothing be left to her.

27.verse: To the sword with all her bulls, going down to the slaughter! Oy to them! Their day has come— the time of their visitation.

28.verse: The sound of fugitives, escaping out of the land of Babylon— declaring in Zion the vengeance of ADONAI our God, vengeance for His Temple.

29.verse: Summon archers to Babylon, all who bend the bow. Encamp against her all around, let no one there escape. Repay her for her deed. As all she has done, do to her. For she was arrogant against ADONAI, against the Holy One of Israel.

30.verse: Therefore her young men will fall in her squares, all her warriors silenced in that day.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

31.verse: “Look, I am against you, arrogant one” —declares my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot— “for your day has come, the time when I will punish you.

32.verse: The arrogant will stumble and fall, and no one will lift him up. I will kindle fire in his cities, and it will devour all who are round about him.”

33.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together. All their captors hold them fast. They refused to let them go.

34.verse: Their Redeemer is strong —ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name— He will vigorously plead their case, so He may give rest to the earth, but trembling to the Babylonians.

35.verse: “A sword is on the Chaldeans” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “and on Babylon’s inhabitants, and her officials and wise men.

36.verse: A sword on the diviners—fools! A sword on her warriors—shattered!

37.verse: A sword on their horses, their chariots, on all the mixed people within her, so they will become like women! A sword on her treasures— so they may be plundered.

38.verse: A drought is on her waters, so they will be dried up. For it is a land of idols— they are mad about horrible things.

39.verse: So wildcats and hyenas will live there and ostriches settle there. It will never again be inhabited or dwelt in from generation to generation.

40.verse: As when Elohim overthrew Sodom, Gomorrah and their neighbor towns” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— so no man will live there, nor any son of man dwell in it.

41.verse: Look! A people coming from the north, a great nation and many kings will rise up from the ends of the earth.

42.verse: They grasp bow and javelin. They are cruel, with no compassion. Their voice roars like the sea, as they ride on horses, arranged as warriors for battle, against you, daughter of Babylon.

43.verse: Babylon’s king heard news of them. His hands droop; anguish grabs him, agony like a woman in labor.

44.verse: Look, it is like a lion coming up from the thickets of the Jordan to a secure pasture— for abruptly I will make him run away from it. I appoint over it whomever I choose. For who is like Me? Who will summon Me to court? What shepherd stands up to Me?”

45.verse: Therefore hear the plan that ADONAI has drawn up against Babylon, and His strategies that He designed against the land of the Chaldeans. Surely the least of the flock will be dragged away, Surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.

46.verse: The earth will tremble at the noise of Babylon’s capture. The sound of their outcry will be heard among the nations.

1.verse: Apocalyptic Vengeance - Thus says ADONAI: “Look! Stirring up against Babylon and those living in Leb-kamai, a spirit of destruction.

2.verse: I will send strangers to Babylon to scatter her and empty her land. For in the day of trouble they will be against her all around.

3.verse: Let the archer bend his bow at her. Let him rise up at her in his armor. Do not spare her young men. Destroy her whole army.

4.verse: They will fall down slain in the land of Chaldea, thrust through in her streets.

5.verse: For neither Israel nor Judah will be widowed by his God, ADONAI-Tzva’ot, though their land is full of guilt before the Holy One of Israel.

6.verse: Flee from within Babylon! Each one, escape with his soul! Be not silenced in her iniquity! For it is a time of vengeance for ADONAI. He will repay her recompense.

7.verse: Babylon has been a golden cup in ADONAI’s hand, intoxicating the whole earth. The nations drunk her wine— so the nations are going crazy.

8.verse: Suddenly Babylon is fallen! Shattered! Howl over her! Bring balm for her wound. Perhaps she may be healed?

9.verse: We would have healed Babylon, but she cannot be healed. Abandon her! Let’s go, each one to his own country, for her judgment has reached up to the heavens and has risen beyond the skies.

10.verse: ADONAI has brought forth our vindication! Come, let us declare in Zion the work of ADONAI Eloheinu!

11.verse: Sharpen the arrows. Fill the quivers! ADONAI has roused the spirit of the kings of the Medes. For His plan is against Babylon, to destroy it. For it is ADONAI’s vengeance, vengeance for His Temple.

12.verse: Raise a banner at Babylon’s walls! Strengthen the guard. Station watchmen. Prepare ambushes. For ADONAI has both planned and accomplished what He spoke about the Babylonians.

13.verse: You dwelling by many waters, rich in treasures, your end has come, the measure of your covetousness.

14.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot has sworn by Himself: “Surely I will fill you with men like a locust swarm, and they will shout cheers over you.”

15.verse: Creator of All, Judge of All - One made the earth by His power, set up the world by His wisdom, and spread out the heavens by His knowledge.

16.verse: At His giving voice— tumult of waters in the skies! He causes clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain and brings forth wind from His storehouses.

17.verse: All mankind is stupid, ignorant. Every goldsmith is disgraced by an idol, for his molten image is a lie— there is no breath in them.

18.verse: They are futile, a work of delusion. In the time of their visitation they will perish.

19.verse: Jacob’s Portion is not like these, for He is the former of all things, including the tribe of His heritage —ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name.

20.verse: “You are My club, a war weapon— with you I shatter nations, with you I destroy kingdoms.

21.verse: With you I wreck horse and rider, with you I wreck chariot and rider,

22.verse: with you I break man and woman, with you I break elder and youth, with you I break young man and maid,

23.verse: with you I scatter shepherd and flock, with you I scatter plowman and ox-team, with you I scatter governors and officials.

24.verse: I will repay Babylon and all living in Chaldea for all their evil that they did in Zion, before your eyes.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

25.verse: “Beware! I am against you, destroyer of the Mount!” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “Destroyer of all the land— I will stretch out My hand at you, roll you down from the cliffs, and make you a burning hill.

26.verse: They will not even take from you a cornerstone or foundation stone, for you will be desolate forever.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

27.verse: Raise a banner in the land! Blow a shofar among the nations! Consecrate the nations against her. Summon against her the kingdoms— Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz. Appoint a marshal against her. Bring horses up like rough locusts.

28.verse: Consecrate the nations against her, the kings of the Medes, its governors and all its deputies, and all the land of his dominion.

29.verse: Now the land shakes and writhes, for ADONAI’s plans against Babylon arise— to make the land of Babylon a desolation without inhabitant.

30.verse: Babylon’s warriors ceased fighting. They stay in their strongholds. Their might is exhausted. They have become like women. Her dwellings are set ablaze, her gate-bars are broken.

31.verse: One runner runs to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to tell Babylon’s king that his city has been taken from end to end.

32.verse: The fords have also been seized and the marshes burned with fire, so the warriors are in panic.

33.verse: For thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel: “The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at treading time. A little longer, and the time of harvest for her will come.”

34.verse: “Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured me, crushed me, set me aside like an empty dish, swallowed me up like a dragon, filled his belly with my delicacies, rinsed me away.”

35.verse: The one dwelling in Zion says: “Let the violence done to me and my flesh be upon Babylon!” Jerusalem says: “My blood be on the Chaldeans!”

36.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI: “Yes, I will uphold your cause and take vengeance for you. I will dry up her sea, and make her fountain dry.

37.verse: Babylon will become heaps, a dwelling for jackals, a horror and a hissing, uninhabited.

38.verse: They roar together like young lions, growl like lions cubs.

39.verse: When they become hot, I will set out a banquet for them and will make them so drunk that they become merry— and then sleep a perpetual sleep and never awake.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

40.verse: “I will drag them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he-goats.

41.verse: How has Sheshach been taken, the praise of the whole earth seized? How has Babylon become a horror among the nations!

42.verse: The sea has risen over Babylon— she is covered with its roaring waves.

43.verse: Her cities became desolation, a dry land, desert, uninhabited land, through which no son of man passes.

44.verse: I will punish Bel in Babylon— What he swallowed I will make him disgorge out of his mouth. Nations will no longer stream to him. Yes, the wall of Babylon has fallen!

45.verse: Come out of her, My people! Each of you, save your soul from the fierce anger of ADONAI.

46.verse: Do not be faint-hearted, or be intimidated by the rumor heard in the land— one year one rumor comes, next year, another rumor. Yet violence will be in the land, with ruler against ruler.

47.verse: Therefore behold, days are coming when I will punish Babylon’s idols. Her entire land will be disgraced and all her slain will fall in her midst.

48.verse: Then heaven and the earth and all that is in them will sing for joy over Babylon, for the destroyers from the north will come to her.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

49.verse: Yes, Babylon is to fall for the slain of Israel, even as the slain of all the earth fell to Babylon.

50.verse: Escapees from the sword, go! Do not stand still! Remember ADONAI from afar— and make aliyah to Jerusalem in your heart.

51.verse: “We were shamed when we heard reproach. Disgrace has covered our faces, for foreigners entered the holy places of ADONAI’s House.”

52.verse: “Therefore behold, days are coming” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “when I will punish her idols, and the wounded will groan throughout all her land.

53.verse: Even if Babylon went up to heaven and even if she fortified the height of her stronghold, from Me destroyers will come to her.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

54.verse: The sound of an outcry from Babylon! Great ruin from the land of Chaldea!

55.verse: For ADONAI is devastating Babylon, and will silence her loud voice. Their waves will roar like many waters. The noise of their voices will resound.

56.verse: For a destroyer is coming against her, against Babylon, and her warriors will be captured, their bows broken. For ADONAI is a God of restitution, He will fully repay.

57.verse: “I will intoxicate her officials and sages, her governors, deputies, and warriors, and they will sleep a perpetual sleep, and not awake.” It is a declaration of the King, whose Name is ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

58.verse: Thus says ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Babylon’s thick wall will be totally razed and her high gates burned with fire. So the peoples are toiling for nothing, and nations weary themselves for fire.”

59.verse: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah son of Neriah, son of Mahseiah, when he went with King Zedekiah of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was quartermaster.

60.verse: And Jeremiah wrote in a single scroll all the evil that would come upon Babylon, including all these words that were written about Babylon.

61.verse: Then Jeremiah said to Seraiah: “When you arrive in Babylon, then see that you read all these words,

62.verse: and say: ‘ADONAI, you have spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that nothing will dwell there, neither man nor beast, but that it will be desolate forever.’

63.verse: “Now when you have finished reading this scroll, you will tie a stone to it and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates.

64.verse: Then you will say: ‘Thus will Babylon sink, and not rise again, because of the calamity that I will bring on her. So they will weary themselves.’” Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.

1.verse: Babylon Destroys Jerusalem - Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king and he reigned 11 years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

2.verse: And he did what was evil in ADONAI’s eyes, just like all Jehoiakim had done.

3.verse: Because of ADONAI’s anger it came to the point in Jerusalem and Judah that He had them cast out of His presence. So Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

4.verse: It came to pass in the ninth year of his reign in the tenth month, the tenth day of the month, that King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon came—he and all his army—against Jerusalem, and besieged it. They built a siege wall all around it.

5.verse: So the city was besieged until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

6.verse: In the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, the famine was so severe in the city, that there was no food for the people of the land.

7.verse: Then the city was broken into, and all the men of war fled, going out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was near the king’s garden—even though the Chaldeans were all around the city. They were heading along the way of the Arabah.

8.verse: But the Chaldean army pursued the king and overtook Zedekiah in the desert plains of Jericho. Then all his army was scattered from him.

9.verse: Then they took the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath. He passed judgment on him.

10.verse: At Riblah, the king of Babylon slaughtered Zedekiah’s sons before his eyes, and also all the Judean leaders.

11.verse: Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes. Then the king of Babylon bound him in bronze chains, and brought him to Babylon, where he put him in prison until the day of his death.

12.verse: Now in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month—which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon—Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard came into Jerusalem to represent the king of Babylon.

13.verse: Then he burned the House of ADONAI, the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem. He burned every large house with fire.

14.verse: Then all the Chaldean army, which was with the captain of the guard, broke down all the walls of Jerusalem all around.

15.verse: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried into exile some of the poorest of the people, the rest of the people who were left in the city, the deserters who had defected to the king of Babylon, and what remained of the craftsmen.

16.verse: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left some of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and plowmen.

17.verse: The Chaldeans smashed the bronze pillars of the House of ADONAI, the stands and the bronze sea that were in the House of ADONAI, and carried all the bronze to Babylon.

18.verse: The pots, the shovels, the wick trimmers, the basins, the pans, and all the bronze articles for Temple service, they also took away.

19.verse: The cups, the fire-pans, the basins, the pots, the menorot, the pans, and the drink offering bowls—whatever was gold or silver—the captain of the guard took away.

20.verse: As for the two pillars, one sea, and twelve bronze bulls that were under the stands that King Solomon had made for the House of ADONAI—all these articles had bronze beyond weighing.

21.verse: The height of one pillar was 18 cubits and it was twelve cubits in circumference and four fingers in its thickness—it was hollow.

22.verse: There was a bronze capital on it—the height of one capital was five cubits, with latticework and pomegranates upon the capital all around, all of bronze. The second pillar was the same, with pomegranates.

23.verse: There were 96 pomegranates on the outside; including all the pomegranates around the lattice, there were 100.

24.verse: Then the captain of the guard took Seraiah the kohen gadol, and Zephaniah the second kohen, and the three doorkeepers.

25.verse: From the city he took an officer who had been appointed over the men of war as well as seven men who saw the king’s face, who were found in the city, the scribe of the commander of the army, who enlisted people of the land, and 60 men of the people of the land who were found within the city.

26.verse: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.

27.verse: The king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. Then Judah was led away into exile from its land.

28.verse: These are the people whom Nebucha-dnez-zar carried away captive: in the seventh year 3,023 Jews;

29.verse: in Nebuchadnez-zar’s eighteenth year, 832 people from Jerusalem;

30.verse: in the Nebuchadnezzar’s twenty-third year, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard exiled 745 of the Jews—all together 4,600 people.

31.verse: Release of King Jehoiachin - Now it came to pass on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month of the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Judah’s King Jehoiachin, that King Evil-merodach of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Judah’s King Jehoiachin, and released him out of prison.

32.verse: He spoke kindly to him and gave him a throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon.

33.verse: Then he changed out of his prison garments, dined regularly before him all the days of his life.

34.verse: As for his allowance, a regular allowance was given to him by the king of Babylon, a portion for each day until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
